The parking was also extremely expensive and the prices weren't accurate on the meter, so had to over pay to stay.

Positive Reviews: Room was clean, staff very helpful, location good in regard to other places to visit which we did mostly by walking, apart from catching a ferry to nearby Island.

Negative Reviews: Kitchenette didn't come with any equipment.  Reception will give you a set (plates, bowls and cutlery) but didn't have anything to wash up with. We managed fine, just something to be aware of.
Positive Reviews: Good location within walking distance to key sites in Seattle. Bus services from right outside made travelling further afield easy. Staff were great, room was clean and comfortable. AC was good too. Shower hot and powerful.

Review Title: I would stay there again for the "Value for the Money".
Negative Reviews: Parking difficult. Buzing noise from the heating system in the court yard all night.
Positive Reviews: Great rooftop terrasse with view of Seattle. Well situated. Comfortable. Staff helpfull. Up-graded to a biggger room for free.

Review Title: A little over priced for what it is but convenient and walkable.
Negative Reviews: This is a popular hotel for those waiting to board or just getting off the cruise ships so the lobby area is crowded at all hours.
Positive Reviews: Great location, walkable to everything we wanted to do. Great staff! Room was clean and surprisingly quiet for a busy area. Rooftop terrace was fun.

Negative Reviews: Noise level of Aircon
Positive Reviews: Good location , staff very friendly and knowledgeable, room size was good and all very clean.

Review Title: Fine for the price - met my needs
Negative Reviews: Hotel setup is weird for interior courtyard rooms, which look across a narrow courtyard into other hotel rooms. If you want privacy you have to close the shades and forgo natural light. Not a huge issue but since I was in the room working during the day I noticed this. My particular room was fine with no one in the rooms across the way, or they had their shades drawn, but I would not have wanted to sit and work for hours with the room right across from me occupied with people looking in mine. Unfortunately many of the rooms on the street overlook the dog park that is also a gathering place for local sheltered and unsheltered folks - also not the greatest for spending daylight hours in the room since the hotel doesn't have many floors and you are pretty close to the street. I had one of these first and moved due to the noise of the housekeeping supply room across the hall where the door banged in the frame every few seconds (while closed) due to air movement in the hallway when the courtyard window was open. It's nice to have a sink and microwave, but you have to ask for plates and silverware and there is no sponge or dishsoap provided so you can't clean up your own dishes.
Positive Reviews: Clean and quiet, fine size, good bed, nice location for my needs. Nothing spectacular but all very serviceable and I would stay again. It's an easy walk down to the waterfront, the Olympic Sculpture Park and Myrtle Edwards Park and beyond, with lots of good food, drink and coffee options nearby.

Review Title: Comfortable and clean with great location. Slightly dated decor more than made up for by the price.
Negative Reviews: There was a large group using the lobby when I checked in so it was quite loud making the check-in process difficult (I’m hard of hearing). Parking isn’t included with room, but I was able to find street parking easily and this was safe and inexpensive (free at night and Sunday).
Positive Reviews: Staff was kind and helpful. Decor is slightly dated but in a charming way. Rooms are clean and very close to attractions and a variety of restaurants. The neighborhood feels safe but there’s also a security officer present at all times as an added layer of comfort and security.

Review Title: Nise enough to consider another stay.
Negative Reviews: AC noisy and cycles on and off and blows directly on you when in bed. Smallish room. Street noise. Seedy neighborhood. 4:00 PM check in (though we were allowed in to our room at 1:30 PM).
Positive Reviews: Nicely furnished and decorated room. Short walk to restaurants and Pike Place market. Very helpful, cordial staff. Lower price relative to many other hotels nearby.

Review Title: Great place for a one night stopover when traveling through Seattle.
Negative Reviews: The hotel is older and the elevator is small. Our room was small as well - a bit cramped by the time we got all of our luggage in the room. Still, these are not things that can be changed. Despite the age, the hotel is in good condition.
Positive Reviews: We reserved a room as a stopover between the end of our cruise and our flight home. The hotel was older but clean; the staff were amazing and helped us reserve a car for an early flight, recommend local restaurants and ensure we had a room with a great view.

Review Title: Location, A+ Staff and the Roof!
Negative Reviews: The bed was a full which I didn't realize when I booked so it was very cozy for us.
Positive Reviews: Great location, easy 13 minute walk to Pike's Market and the Space Needle.  The staff is friendly and accommodating, free coffee and water throughout the day, well appointed clean rooms with just what you need.  The roof top area is fantastic!  Gorgeous views and comfy seating.  We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay for the price.

Review Title: The Belltown Inn met our needs for comfort and convenience for a night in Seattle.
Negative Reviews: The room felt cramped. Fair warning to travelers who aren't used to cities: the neighborhood was a combination of gentrification and living on the street. I don't know enough about Seattle to know whether all the downtown neighborhoods are like this.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is within walking distance of the Paramount, which enabled us to walk to the show we were in town for. It's also within walking distance of the Pike Place Market, but the parking we paid for allowed in and out, so we drove. The staff was super nice. The room itself was nice enough but a little dated. The bed was comfortable, but too close to the desk. If someone was sitting at the desk, he had to move out of the way for the other person to get to the far side of the bed.

Review Title: Nice place in an amazing location
Negative Reviews: We booked 2 of the same rooms. One of our rooms was for two people and two small dogs, it was much smaller than the one they gave our travel companion who was single occupancy.
Positive Reviews: Friendly staff. Great location. Clean comfortable rooms. Elevator always arrived quickly.

Negative Reviews:
Offsite parking (which is disclosed): choice of open lot about a half block away or underground garage. When we arrived to check in and we’re parked in front of the hotel, there were numerous homeless people arguing and talking about drugs. Obviously the hotel has no control over this, however, we were concerned about leaving our truck in the street lot as it has a topper on it with some fishing gear in it (we can’t take all this into the room). We chose the underground garage (same price). Access is in an alley and once you find a stall (we had to go down a couple of levels to find one we could get our truck into), there is no access to the stairs or elevator to get out. You have to walk around the driving area to exit.
Would suggest the open lot if you have a larger vehicle or mobility issues. This is just for information for people with a vehicle- the hotel itself is excellent.
Positive Reviews: Close to Chihuly Glass and Pikes Market. Room and facilities very clean and staff was awesome. Rooftop sitting area was great- sat up there in the evening with a beverage and it was lovely. Has laundry room on site which was great for us since we had been traveling for a week. Also, they have security at the front door in the evenings.

Review Title: Cosy room, friendly & helpful staff, super location
Negative Reviews: Global problem, but bed was changed even though I left the "do not change" sign prominently on the bed- a bug- bear of mine.  Also a city- wide issue, but parking difficult on- street or very expensive off- street.
Positive Reviews: Warm, cosy room, friendly staff,  great location.  Many shops, bars,  restaurants all within a block or two, walking distance to many Seattle attractions.  The rooftop terrace wasn't too appealing in October but would probably by glorious in summer.

Negative Reviews:
Parking is 33 per night, we managed to get a spot in their very limited space kitty-corner of the hotel. 
The location is not very safe, many homeless people (which makes me sad). I wouldn't go out alone.
Small rooms, ours must have been very low-rated (view on a dirty backstreet and close to the next building) even we paid a lot. 
Check out was at least average.
Positive Reviews:
Very good location, you can almost walk everywhere. Rooms quite small but okay. They have an awesome rooftop (that's why you see it on most pictures) where we spend almost an hour at night just standing there to see that fantastic overlook of Seattle. Don't miss it! Free coffee (very good) with flavored milk available.
Check in was very nice and helpful. I would stay there again because of the very good location. 
Bus stops very close in just 3 minutes walking distance.

Review Title: Great value for money visit which we enjoyed
Negative Reviews: The wardrobe hanging space was compromised because the safe was below it not leaving enough space for clothes to hang properly. The shower was over the bath with no height adjustment. The location of the hotel was great to reach the attractions however the area had a lot of homeless drug users sleeping on the street that said we were never bothered by them.
Positive Reviews: Staff were very friendly and helpful. The central location was good to visit the attractions. Bike's were available and looked to be in good condition.

Review Title: The hotel was clean with a very friendly staff.
Negative Reviews: There is only one elevator and it is on the slower side.
Positive Reviews: The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful throughout our stay.  We loved the central location making it easy to walk just about everywhere.  We were also able to take the link from SEA/TAC to a stop that was less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel and the cost was only $3/ person.  The room was on the smaller side but very clean and a great place for us to rest our head at night.  There was a lovely little rooftop deck along with complimentary bikes.  We were able to walk to the Space Needle, Pike’s Public Market, and the ferry terminal. Just like with any city there is a larger population of unhoused individuals on the street, but the hotel does lock the lobby doors and have security on site at night.  We never felt unsafe or at risk it is just something to be aware of when staying most places in the city.

Review Title: Good place for a short stay.
Negative Reviews: No parking. I had to go down the street to park my car.
Positive Reviews: Great and helpful staff. Great location. Nice room and lobby area.

Review Title: Solo women  weekend trip to Seattle
Negative Reviews:
Didn't like the sound of the ac (that's very loud) nor the sound of the streets at night (even though there's litteraly 2 sets of windows we can still hear the streets at night). Wifi is slow. 
Also the street can be a little scary at night but I feel like that's going to be the case of any hotel in Seattle. If you're a woman traveling alone, don't walk after sunset and catch an Uber.
Positive Reviews:
Loved the very friendly staff and the fact that the location is close to all the major points of interest (walk distance max is maybe 10min to pike place, the space Needle, the waterfront...).
Beds were very very comfortable, and I was upgraded for free to a king size bed!
The rooftop was amazing and allows you to have a safe night gazing at the lights!

Negative Reviews: Parking in another building, off a sketchy alley, was awkward.
Positive Reviews: Very quiet, clean rooms and personable staff. Great location for walking to Pike Place Market, the waterfront and the Space Needle.

Negative Reviews: Slow elevator
Positive Reviews: Great staff!  Very clean!   Clean! Clean! Clean!  I have stayed in a lot of hotels and this hotel smelt fresh and clean!  Great job on housekeeping! They even allow dogs! Close to everything!  Walking distance to Space Needle/ Pikes market!

Negative Reviews: Honestly the room was a little dark and small, but I was really out most of the time.
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect, easy walking distance to so many of Seattle's main attractions.  Price was definitely good for location.  Rooms are clean but on the smaller size, but you'll be out exploring so it won't matter.  Front desk staff wfas friendly and helpful with recommendations for sight-seeing and restaurants.
The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! Our view was really good and the parking wasn't too bad either this time of year! The hotel was very clean and nice!

Stayed a second time at this property on the same trip because it is such a walkable location. This time we had a city view room with a sliding glass door. I loved opening it for fresh air and city sounds. There is a great soundproofing slider as well. The lobby has water and coffee. The in room coffee pot comes with a decaf option, if you need that. The staff is all so welcoming and accommodating.

Review Title: Overall we had a great stay the staff were awesome and wouldn’t mind returning!
Negative Reviews: The surrounding neighborhood can get loud with yelling individuals and police sirens. A lot of potentially sketch individuals around the dog park area across the street
Positive Reviews: The location was great walking distance to pikes/the wharf or up to the space needle and inward we didn’t need to drive at all. The staff were friendly and helpful to any questions, and the room was clean and comfortable!

Negative Reviews: Everything was great. I had no problem or no dislikes. Thank you
Positive Reviews: I liked everything. The location was walking distance to where we needed to go. The parking was decent. The staff was really nice. The room was nice and had a little balcony facing the city. Room and restroom was clean.

Review Title: Perfect! Excellent location and amazing room!
Positive Reviews: Excellent location! Very friendly and helpful staff. The room was perfect and we could see the Space Needle from our room!!

Negative Reviews: Nothing.
Positive Reviews: Rooftop deck. Comfortable room. Friendly staff.  Water in lobby was refreshing.  Good location.

excellent location, spacious clean room with kitchenette. Nice helpful staff.  The city has problems with homeless people, as a solo traveler, never felt unsafe. The hotel does have an overnight security and front doors lock at 10 pm. 
I definitely recommend and will stay here again!

Review Title: 2nd time staying there. Went back there because of the great experience the first time. This 2nd time for a couple more
Negative Reviews: Nothing that I can think of.
Positive Reviews: Location is awesome. So much stuff within walking distance. The staff is awesome and very friendly and attentive. They keep the lobby and rooms nice and clean.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Very clean rooms. Comfortable bed. Location very good. 10 to 15 minutes walk to Space Need and Pike's Place. Staffs are very friendly.

Review Title: Very comfortable, secure hotel accommodation with ideal central location to visit the attractions.
Positive Reviews:
Quiet, end of corridor location for the room.
The room staff were very good
The complimentary coffee everyday in the foyer
The complimentary toiletries in the room
The in-room kitchenette  with fridge, coffee and tea making facilities and snacks with tray containing plates and cutlery on request.
Laundry room

Negative Reviews: The heater was really noisy and it felt somewhat unsafe walking at night
Positive Reviews: the coffee was nice in the morning, staff was always helpful, business center was convenient, the room was very quiet

Review Title: The hotel is decent, not extravagant by any means but there are little perks like some treats in the room and water and
Negative Reviews: There are some dicey characters around the hotel at night.
Positive Reviews: Close to everything! We walked everywhere. The hotel is clean and the staff are great. The location is excellent and between downtown and the Seattle Center/ Space Needle. It suits our needs and we will continue to stay at the property even with the friendly neighbors.

Negative Reviews: The only thing that remotely comes to mind are that there are a lot of homeless people on the street, but the hotel was very nice and also had security. The homeless didn't really bother us, so I am really not complaining.
Positive Reviews: Room was very clean and updated! We walked to the sights that we wanted to visit. Fairly easy walk to Pike Market and Space Needle, we also walked to the Starbucks Roastery. We stayed a few days before our Cruise so we could see some of the sights of Seattle. We rode the lite rail from the airport to the station a few blocks away from the hotel, so it was economical in means of transportation. There are also bus stops around the hotel if needed. They also have access to a shuttle service to the pier for around $10, which we were not aware of prior to our stay, but the front desk clerk informed us

The staff was amazing. This was our first visit to Seattle and there we some concerns staying downtown. However, we felt comfortable and safe. The check in was easy and the room was comfortable. The location is great for Pike Market and Space Needle. Would definitely stay again.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Modern building with attention to details. Room was clean and cozy, very central position. The staff is super friendly and professional. Highly recommed

Negative Reviews: Can’t think of anything at the moment.
Positive Reviews: Welcoming, helpful, and personable staff,a pleasant room (that was easy to keep the temperature comfortable), great location for walking and transit. Also enjoyed the comfort and decor of the lobby and roof. Nice to have a laundry too!

Review Title: The Inn was clean, staff was exceptional, location was perfect, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Negative Reviews: I have no complaints. I totally enjoyed my stay.
Positive Reviews: The location was perfect!! So centrally located and even though there was no on-site parking we were able to secure parking through the Inn for a lot just up the road. The room was clean, and the staff was so incredibly friendly! There were even on-site laundry facilities so we washed all our clothes before heading back home. Would totally stay there again.

Review Title: A bit pricey for what we got, but it's Seattle
Positive Reviews: The staff was great, but the elevator was broken. We were comped free parking, however, which was worth the minor inconvenience. The bed wasn't the most comfortable, but the room was clean and the location was great.

Negative Reviews: Nothing!
Positive Reviews: Great location. Close to pike place and the space needle. Very very clean room which for me, is most important. Nice firm comfy bed. Friendly staff. I have no complaints.

Review Title: This spot is amazing and I recommend it for anyone staying in Seattle!
Positive Reviews: The location is ideal. The staff is extremely friendly. The hotel is always clean and comfortable. I love the balcony on top. Proximity to parking is also helpful. Love that it is pet friendly and located by a dog park.

Review Title: I loved the Belltown and I would go back.
Positive Reviews: my only complaint is that the room was small.  Its not even a complaint, its just what you get downtown in an old building.  don't let "old building" turn you off because its fully updated and fresh feeling.  it was the cleanest hotel I've been in ... maybe ever.  staff was super friendly.  location is right in Belltown so perfect if your visiting the market. 15 min walk to the Space Needle.  Parking was super close and secure but across the street down an alley so you have to check in and get the fob first.

Review Title: Very convenient location with great hospitality
Positive Reviews: The property is close to the Space Needle and Pike Place Market. Very friendly and helpful staff that held our luggage prior to check in, notified us when our room was ready, and had our luggage waiting in the room.

Negative Reviews: Nothing to add
Positive Reviews: Location. Staff was really nice. Nice rooms and lobby.

Review Title: Clean! Friendly staff, but overpriced for such a basic hotel. Save your money and get an airbnb
Negative Reviews: Price. This place was one of the cheaper locations to choose from and that's just unbelievable. I know Seattle is expensive but it was nearly $600 total for two nights, this wasn't a luxury room it was bare essentials. Kind of a bummer to be honest. I had a great time visiting but felt kind of ripped off, it's no wonder there's homeless all over the city...
Positive Reviews:
Everything was as expected. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, TV worked well & the bathroom was nice.
Great location, very nice employees.

Negative Reviews: The blackout curtain was great, but would like to also have a curtain that lets in some light while blocking the view into the window (some of the rooms look into each other's windows across the alley/courtyard).
Positive Reviews:
As this was my second visit to Seattle, I took advantage of the free bike rentals to go visit some neighbourhoods I hadn't been to before. The bikes were awesome - light weight and 16 speed with easy gear changes, so even though Seattle is hilly in places, they bikes were easy to use. 

The hotel itself is clean, staff super friendly. It's really close (walking distance) to Pike Market, Westlake Shopping Center, lots of other things.

Negative Reviews: Parking was expensive but available. A fully functional cell phone is a necessity for everything in the area.
Positive Reviews: Location  was central to major Seattle attractions but still involved a fair bit of walking. Restaurants in the area. Area traffic not as busy as I expected. Hotel was up to date and clean. Price was competitive for the area. Staff was competent and helpful.

Review Title: everything’s good except the price is pretty high but no parking
Negative Reviews: no parking. $30 for parking overnight.
Positive Reviews: good location,many restaurants around,nice staff,room very clean

Negative Reviews:
One elevator can create a bit of a bottleneck especially as guests leave to meet a cruise ship.
Otherwise it doesn't seem anything fits a "didn't like" category.
Positive Reviews:
Great location. We travel frequently and this property although older, in many ways equals mid tier offerings from the majors. Would certainly stay here again.
Clean. Remarkably quiet. Comfortable bed and room size.. attentive staff. Room assistants did a great job.
Almost had a ambience like a bed/ breakfast inn.

Review Title: This is a great clean and comfy hotel at a great price in downtown Seattle.
Negative Reviews: Thin walls and doors. Could hear every door opening and slamming shut. Footsteps and other guests talking throughout the night……The pros of this hotel absolutely outweigh a few noises. Will be staying every time I visit Seattle!
Positive Reviews: Easiest fastest check in ever. Nicest and most helpful staff. Everything is super clean and I can stay with my dog! Staff also had great recommendations for food and beverages. Can’t beat the location either.

Negative Reviews: Noise and light isolation are not great: you can hear people in the hallway clearly and it's too bright with shades closed, so bring a sleep mask. You can't control the thermostat.
Positive Reviews: Complimentary coffee is exceptional. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are large and well stocked: drinking glasses, free snacks, water bottles. The bed is spotless (I check thoroughly for bedbugs). Location is excellent: close to nightlife, the market, and bus stops (though it's a solid 10min walk to the light rail).

Review Title: Good downtown option, under $200 indie hotel.
Negative Reviews: For the price I can't complain.  Bed was fine and clean.  Not super comfy but fine.
Positive Reviews: Downtown.  Great staff, next to a great biscuit breakfast place.   Room was nice enough.  AC worked, quiet room.  They have bikes and street parking is possible, although 30 a day is fine for this neighborhood.  Close to Pike Place Market and a bunch of other downtown areas.  If you are used to city vibes the area is fine.  Morning coffee was legit.

Negative Reviews: Water pressure was a little low in the shower, but the water was hot.
Positive Reviews: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was very clean and comfortable, and the bath towels were exceptionally large and fluffy!  The location is great, and there are a lot of bars and restaurants in the neighborhood.  We walked almost everywhere during our stay and found that most attractions were only 10 min away by foot, or were accessible by the SEA Link train.  Overall it was an excellent value for the price, and I would definitely stay here again.

Review Title: great location, great staff, cute room :-)
Negative Reviews: the bathroom door didn't have a lock, which i thought was odd. And that is my only complaint.
Positive Reviews: place was clean. Staff was super friendly and cool. Window view of the city was beautiful and there were a bunch of restaurants, bars, and attractions within walking distance

Review Title: It was quiet, comfortable and checked all the boxes for what we needed. Seattle is a beautiful town.
Negative Reviews: The price was pretty steep for a small room. But, we were in Seattle, downtown Seattle. We were on the bottom floor. So no cool view. But it was OK, we just needed a room for one night.
Positive Reviews: The room was comfortable, bed soft. Bathroom and room very clean. It wasn't a big room, but adequate space for what we needed. Free coffee was wonderful. The very helpful and friendly staff made our day. The location of the hotel was central and you could walk to many points of interest. The rooftop area to have coffee or eat and enjoy the city view.

Review Title: Nice friendly hotel near to everything in Seattle
Negative Reviews: There are a lot of homeless people hanging around in the neighbourhood plus I wouldn’t walk back there after dark as there but I guess that’s everywhere in Seattle. Roof terrace was closed - would have been nice if that had been mentioned when booking as was a reason for choosing.
Positive Reviews: Really friendly & efficient check in. Centrally located so easy to get to sites & restaurants. Nice room

Negative Reviews: I was a bit hesitant when we were walking up to the hotel and 3rd Ave had a lot of homeless people up and down the street but I was pleasantly surprised with how nice the hotel was and they even had security at the front door in the evening.
Positive Reviews: The whole hotel is recently remodeled and clean. The staff was SO kind, friendly and helpful. We had a choice of what room location we wanted and a FREE upgrade! Complimentary snacks and drinks in the room and bikes that you could check out. Dog park right across the street. I would 100% stay here again!

Awesome staff and clean hotel/ convenient location/ $10 shuttle to cruise ship/ walk a few blocks to Anthony’s restaurant on water and Pike Place which was awesome too. 1 road is loaded with homeless.  We never felt threatened.  Walked right past them- but be cautious of course. Can’t beat the hotel for price!!!

Negative Reviews: Homeless people outside. But they left you alone for the most part, it's just sad to see them I suppose.
Positive Reviews: Location is the best part, midway to the Seattle Center and Pike Place...very walkable. Close by to multiple restaurants, with biscuit bitch right outside, as well as a grocery store across the street. Bus stops conveniently close by...literally across the street both ways. Friendly staff, great towels, beds comfy, rooms clean and a good size. This is my second stay here, and I recommend to all my friends

Review Title: I seen alot of sketchy reviews but Belltown Inn made my first trip to Seattle great!
Negative Reviews: N/A everything was great.
Positive Reviews: Check in was very simple and the guy who checked us in was very helpful with food recommendations and nearby spots. Room was clean and perfect for the getaway. The rooftop was a great place to hang out at nighttime. Good breakfast spot right next door and location was in the middle of all activities we had planned. No need for a taxi everything was 5-10 minutes walking distance. Will definitely be staying here again next time I make my way out to Seattle.

Review Title: great hotel in good location for a short weekend in Seattle
Negative Reviews: bring some earplugs if you are a light sleeper, that will help with noisy neighbors
Positive Reviews: location is great, you can walk up everywhere, and there lots of cafe and restaurants around. staff is super nice and helpful. we were able to checkin earlier since they had rooms available.

Negative Reviews: The only thing missing was a pool/hot tub! But we were there to sight see in Seattle so we didn’t miss them too much!
Positive Reviews: It was in a perfect location and we could easily walk to most Seattle sights and restaurants that peaked our interest. The rooftop patio was so nice and had lovely city skyline views. The rooms were pleasant. The staff gave amazing recommendations for food and were so helpful and friendly!

Negative Reviews: Nothing.
Positive Reviews: Great location for sightseeing. The front desk staff is very friendly and knowledge about local restaurants. The room we had was very comfortable and quiet. I love that the room had a kitchenette.

Review Title: Belltown made my trip easy and enjoyable.
Negative Reviews: No complaints
Positive Reviews: The staff was great, welcoming and helpful. Everything is very clean and pleasant. I was given a complimentary upgrade which was unexpected and nice. It is very quiet. My room overlooked a sweet little dog park so I was constantly entertained by watching the dogs play. I came for a show at the Art Museum, a 1/2 mile away, so I could walk there. Pike Street Market is on the way to the museum so I could spend time exploring it on the way back. Bitchin Bisquits is next door so your breakfast needs are met. Oh, and did I mention the giant plush bath towel. I would definitely stay there again.

Negative Reviews: Lower price, lol
Positive Reviews: Friendly service from staff (Ariel), clean and comfortable rooms, great locations, near to restaurants, I would stay here again!

This was my third time staying at Belltown Inn. My first time was back in 2012 and I remember what a pleasant experience it was so the second time I visited I decided to stay here again because the staff was friendly, the rooms were clean and it is located close to major tourist attractions. . So this time, many years later, I decided to stay here again, and I'm so glad I did. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. I arrived a couple of hours before check -in time, and thankfully, my room was ready to go, which is a good thing because it was pouring outside. I can not express how much I appreciate the staff from the morning, midday, and late night they are all very friendly! Thank you for making my stay so pleasant. Next time I'm in seattle, I know where I'll be staying. 

Location wise, there is a bus stop that drops you off across the street if you're coming from the airport and just to the left on the other side of the street you can take the 2,5 or ,24 local to Union Street (3 stops), and from there, you can hop on the light rail located in Unveristy Station. Like I said, the Inn is located in a very convenient part of the city with lots of great restaurants nearby. I highly recommend Belltown Inn as a great place to stay :)

Review Title: Great value, great location, great stay.
Negative Reviews: Sadly, the neighborhood is a bit sketchy - not the hotel but the street.
Positive Reviews: Great location to theater and restaurants, friendly and knowledgable staff, hotel feels safe and secure, the room was clean and quiet, checking in and out was a breeze.

Review Title: If given the opportunity, I would return to the Belltown Inn without question.
Negative Reviews: There was nothing not to like. Unfortunately,  the "unhoused" are tucked away in doorways. This may be disconcerting for some travelers, but it did not really bother us.
Positive Reviews: Staff was friendly and professional.  The hotel is centrally located to tourist attractions and plenty of restaurants, including a live jazz supper club.  The room was tidy and quaint, with plenty of TV choices and efficiency kitchen stocked with pretty tasty coffee.  It is also on a major bus line so getting around the city by public transportation is accessible.
The Location. The Staff was Great! They gave great recommendations for restaurants in the area. I like that there's a washer and dryer. The room was clean and comfortable.

Negative Reviews: Cost - but this is Seattle not the specific hotel - is very expensive.
Positive Reviews:
Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location for walking around city - but there is a large homeless population in Seattle and they generally congregate in the Belltown area. Visitors aren't in danger but it can be hard and unpleasant. I wish the hotel had a small continental breakfast but there are restaurant options close by... and it was easy to walk to the cruise terminal with luggage. 
I would definitely stay here again.

Review Title: Fridge and Microwave in the rooms, clean room, out standing staff!
Positive Reviews: This location turned out to be exactly what we needed! Its walking distance from what would be considered the tourist area ie Pike Place. The room we stayed in has a small kitchenette fridge and microwave which was great for all the food we picked up at the market! I really loved the staff they’re all so inviting and made sure to always greet us they all seem to actually like their jobs which is refreshing! very clean!

Negative Reviews: I prefer secure parking when visiting downtowns. The parking lot itself was great, and cost (30/day) was reasonable for the location. Parking offsite isn't ideal though. The walk was short, but you need to return the fob at check out, which means moving your car out of the lot and finding street parking specifically for check out. Finding street parking can be difficult in the morning. It's nice to be able to check out, then drive off. They are doing the best they can with the situation, just a minor inconvenience.
Positive Reviews: Great location. Clean Rooms. Good value. Friendly staff

Review Title: I loved staying here and will be back to stay again in the future.
Negative Reviews: Parking in Seattle sucks, as it's very expensive, but this hotel offers paid for parking just 2 buildings away, so you can pay to keep your care there, and it seems very secure.
Positive Reviews: I was really surprised with this good location. Easily within walking distance to the Space Needle and Pikes Place Market. Many restaurants located around the area. Bus service was across the street. My room was a King on the corner, 2nd floor. I'd request this room again as there are 2 openable windows to allow the air in. It is very busy in the city, so lots of traffic noises, but nothing I wasn't prepared for.  My room and bed area was very clean; it came with a small kitchenette so microwave, mini fridge, sink and coffee maker. The staff can stock you with extra coffee or cheese-its if your request.   The staff was exceptionally helpful and kind. I would come and stay here again.

Negative Reviews: Only one small elevator and during busy times, had to wait quite a long time.
Positive Reviews: Nice location by restaurants. Room was quiet even though in busy neighborhood. Staff very friendly and attentive and parking lot close by.

Negative Reviews: There was only one elevator and it was exceptionally slow. It was also out of order one day of the trip. We walked a lot and a couple of blocks away from the hotel there is a lot of homeless, especially after dark. We were rarely approached though, and we were comfortable with the situation. Almost everywhere we went in Seattle it was the same, some places worse, some better, but we never felt unsafe.
Positive Reviews: Exceptionally clean, very comfortable bed, great staff, very friendly and accommodating, wonderful location for public transportation and for walking to major sites. Also many restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. We also loved having the small kitchenette (sink, counter, microwave, coffee pot, mini fridge). Free wifi was good and I had no problem with speed. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the courtyard at the end of a hallway and it was extremely quiet. Oh, and the rooftop terrace was sooooo nice!

Negative Reviews: The only downside to our stay was the elevator broke down. We stayed on the 5th floor. The 1rst time it really didn’t matter because we used the stairs to come down. The next time it broke is when we were checking out and we had all our luggage (I’m a girl who doesn’t travel lightly, lol) Our luggage was heavy and we had 6 pieces. Going down 5 floors with all that stuff was not fun!
Positive Reviews: Online booking and communication online was great! We read the reviews and asked for a quiet room. So thankful for all the help in fulfilling our requests. Staff was amazing! Wolfgang was awesome, knowledgeable, courteous and informative for our questions. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. We loved the roof top! What a great view with comfy chairs and tables. Front desk area had ice water to keep us hydrated! You can even check out bicycles if you wanted too! Great location with Breakfast right next store. Kiddie corner to the hotel was a Asian restaurant, Korean restaurant and a pho restaurant. We also stopped by the grocery store that is really close too. Parking is close to the hotel. We parked at the lot down from the pho restaurant and across the street from the grocery store. You down load the app and pay. The cost was $50 a day with all the fees. We stayed there 3 days. There are NO in-&-out privileges. We walked everywhere. You have to pay for parking everywhere. The dog park across the street from the hotel is busy. We did see homeless people but no one was rude or outspoken. We felt safe. We also did not stay out later than 9pm.

Negative Reviews: location - drug dealers, people with mental health issues on this particular block.
Positive Reviews: Friendly staff, clean room, 5 minute walk from conference center, public transport

Negative Reviews:
While the location was within walking distance to everything we wanted. Out of the control of the hotel, the homeless population made it uncomfortable. 
And the coffee in the hotel was terrible.. 
all of these  are just minor setbacks..
Positive Reviews: Staff and service was exceptional! Room was clean and had a wonderful view.

Negative Reviews: While the location of the Belltown Inn is great to get to places like Pikes and Downtown there are quite a few homeless around the area.  There have been a few times we felt uncomfortable but never afraid for our safety.
Positive Reviews: Great location and very friendly staff.  The room was very clean and housekeeping did a great job keeping it clean.  Will be back for sure!

Negative Reviews:
While the location was convenient, it was kind of dead. Especially if you are from another country it might be surprising for you. I'm used to people being out and about all day, lots of businesses that are open early and/or late, etc. It makes me feel safer to see other people about. I wouldn't say this is an unsafe neighborhood, but being used to something very different was a little stressful. It might be a really different experience on the weekend though. We were there two weekday nights. Despite the deserted feeling of the location, I'd still say it's a good place for a one night stay if you want to take the train from King Street Station in the morning. It's either a short bus ride or short and cheap cab ride. The cab was only around $7 and we had big pieces of luggage so we used that.

Nothing negative to say about the hotel itself.
Positive Reviews: The staff were really great and helpful. The room was nice, clean, and comfy. The location was convenient, but there were some negative aspects to it as well.

Review Title: perfect for a few cheap days in Seattle before our road trip
Negative Reviews: location
Positive Reviews:
roof terraces currently closed
good location to walk everywhere
basic but clean abs safe location. 
staff helpful

Negative Reviews: location was a little concerning because of the street foot traffic.
Positive Reviews: location, clean, staff

Negative Reviews: no view  outside to streets .
Positive Reviews: Able to get on the roof to view outside. Great location to walk to attractions. . Staff real nice. Rooms were clean and comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The location not in a very safe location
Positive Reviews:
Very friendly staff  the room was very clean 
Beds comfortable 
Walking distance to Farmer Market

Review Title: Great place to stay in the middle of everything.
Negative Reviews: I get that location is everything but you'll spend a pretty penny to stay here, especially in the summer, in a 2 star hotel.
Positive Reviews: Front desk staff was very friendly and even checked me in a little bit early. I asked a couple staff members for recommendations on where to go nearby and they were happy to help. The room was very clean and looked to be recently remodeled. A couple perks, there's a rooftop which I took advantage of, and they have rental bikes which is also used to check out Pike Place Market.

Negative Reviews: The location was sketchy, the hotel is old but it is American style and large.
Positive Reviews: The manager and receptionist were so kind and helpful, they even upgraded our room so we don’t share a single bed, me and my brother. The room was big enough and there was a sink and coffee maker with complimentary coffee and biscuits there. Lots of clean towel and comfy bed. Two good and large windows giving you a landscape view of mostly homeless crowd on the street. 😬

Negative Reviews: Not specific to this location but hotel prices in Seattle are extortionate - 400 USD for one night is nuts
Positive Reviews:
Good location and security considering the area
Staff friendly and room very clean.

Negative Reviews: Location lots of drug activity you are forced to be exposed to walk by & see out in open
Positive Reviews: Was clean staff helpful & good customer service. Good location if you are wanting to a short travel to Pike Market. But location also has a ton of drug activity you have to walk by & see out in the open so very sad. Hotel itself if you stay off 3rd is good & staff were very nice made check in fast & easy.

Review Title: Management is incredible. They train the staff well. As a guest, I was well taken care of. Memorable
Negative Reviews: It would be nice if there were security guards around since there are a lot of homeless people around the location. Other than that I enjoyed my stay.
Positive Reviews:
Overall, I am satisfied with my stay here! I'd stay here again.

Cleanliness 
10/10 Inside the hotel, public bathroom, and my room. Looks, feels, and smells clean! I was impressed by how carefully placed the items in my room were.

Staff
10/10 Incredibly kind and helpful. I had special requests in my booking, and I was immediately given a response. In person, the staff members greeted me and asked me about my stay. They gave useful recommendations based on my interests, and guided me how to get the most out of my stay here. 

Location
8/10 It's a major plus how the hotel is walking distance from a lot of the tourist areas. I will mention that there are a lot of homeless people roaming around nearby, although they seemed harmless. So in the day time I felt safe. 

Appreciate
Free bikes, helmet, lock, and basket! On the less rainy days, I loved traveling with the bike. 
I like how they let me leave my bags after I checked out while I explored the city.
I appreciated the early check-in. I like that I was given the option of being able to choose a balcony room or courtyard.
Fresh water options and ice
Even though I don't participate in Comicon, it's nice how the hotel had events for comicon. They were hosting a costume contest. It seems like the hotel really supports and values the community.

Review Title: The bed was comfortable, but I’ll never stay there again.
Negative Reviews: No pool, no hot tub, no breakfast and the toilet in the bathroom was the smallest toilet and lowest to the floor I have ever seen. Like a 3rd world country toilet. Incredibly outdated.
Positive Reviews: Location, the bed, the pillows, the rooftop and the staff.

Review Title: Hidden gem in a maze of under- and over-rated Seattle hotels. Highly recommended.
Negative Reviews: The location was fine, but there were a lot of unseemly characters congregating around the building. It appeared that they might be homeless. It was somewhat intimidating. Not having on-site parking was an inconvenience but tolerable since the parking lot used by the hotel was only one block away.
Positive Reviews: Rooms are small but very well appointed including fridge, microwave and coffee maker. All furnishings seemed to be relatively high end. There was no view but that didn't matter since I wasn't there to spend time in my room. Everything was immaculate. There were plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. Easy to get almost anywhere downtown from here. Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Review Title: Great place in Seattle only short walk away from main attractions, clean safe and friendly staff
Negative Reviews: Everything was great
Positive Reviews: Short walk to the market and space needle, spacious room, super friendly staff, luggage storage, plenty bars and restaurants around the corner

The professionalism and friendlness of the staff rates five stars.   The rooms are a bit small, but very comfortable and we were happy to have the small kitchenette.  We could easily walk to Pike Place Market and the Space Needle.  Belltown's central location is a big plus.  There were good restaurants just around the corner and we really enjoyed our stay.

Review Title: Good value for money in a good location
Negative Reviews: Definitely shows its age and could use a bit of modernizing but if you manage your expectations before heading in, you'll still enjoy your stay.
Positive Reviews: Location is excellent and price is good compared to nearby properties. Staff is very welcoming and nice. Easy to walk to downtown and several restaurants, bars, cafés, etc. Rooms are comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The area seemed a bit sketchy with homeless people.  That is no fault of the hotel and I was very surprised at the great accommodation.
Positive Reviews: The location of the hotel was great, since we were taking a cruise.  It is also very close to the Market.  Front desk staff were helpful.  They let us into a clean room early and were great with recommending restaurants.  Room was clean and very comfortable, good water pressure.    Nice to have extra coffee in the lobby as well as water with lemon.  Did not use them because we were there for only 1 night, but there are bikes available on a first come basis.  Just remember the waterfront is downhill.

Review Title: Great hotel in a great location.
Negative Reviews: We took light rail from the airport and walked from the light rail station to the hotel down 3rd Ave. The walk was flat and not too far but the stretch from the station towards the hotel is not the best example of Seattle streets. It did not feel unsafe during the day but there were a number of homeless and "characters" along the way. The area closer to the hotel was fine. If you do the walk, go right over to 4th Ave and then down to the hotel.
Positive Reviews: The location was excellent for us. Walking distance to the Space Needle and Pike Place Market. It appears that the whole hotel was renovated not long ago as everything was in great shape. Everything was fresh and clean and the staff were courteous and helpful. We ate dinner the first night right around the corner at Marrakesh which was very good and the waiter was very friendly (we were there early so it was not busy). He suggested La Parisian Bakery for breakfast which was also just a short walk from the hotel and highly recommended. He also suggested we get the the CityPass which we normally would not normally have purchased but it worked out very well and we ended up doing a short harbor cruise, the Space Needle, Chihuly Garden and Glass display as well as a rainy day visit to the aquarium, perhaps a few things we would not have done had we had to pay for them individually.

Review Title: Great place to stay while visiting Seattle
Negative Reviews: Be mindful that this is in the downtown area, and although we never felt un-safe, there are a lot of homeless people and apparent drug users in the immediate area.  We had to walk by them, but they never approached, panhandled, or bothered us in anyway, maybe because the local police have a strong presence.  Also, the hotel entrance has a security person after hours.  The morning of our departure, we left very early and walked to the subway/rail system (about ten minutes) to catch train back to the airport (about 30 minutes), and the streets were virtually empty of homeless people, so we can only surmise that there are anti-loitering rules during certain hours.
Positive Reviews:
We spent four nights here.  It was a little pricey, but worth it.  We liked the friendly and helpful 24/7 front desk service.  The location was perfect, and as the hotel claims, you really can "walk to everything" - the waterfront, Pike Place Market, the Space Needle, restaurants, etc.  There are lots of little neighborhood eateries, bakeries and a convenience store across the street.  We especially enjoyed a little Italian place a few blocks away.  The room was very small, but modern, well appointed with nice furniture and exceptionally clean.  We asked for a quiet room and it was.  (Fifth floor, facing courtyard.)   We depended on our feet and the bus system to get around and it worked out great.  There is a bus stop directly outside and a subway/rail stop ten minutes away by foot or three stops by bus.  We were even able to catch a direct bus from our hotel way out to the Flight Museum for a dollar each (senior fare).  What a deal!

We were also impressed with the housekeeping service.  Even though we waived the need for daily clean linens and towels, they still came in every day and straightened the bed, emptied trash, refilled coffee station, etc.

Negative Reviews: Not the hotel’s fault! Seattle is a city and like many cities, it has homeless people. The neighborhood is improving but still shows signs of overnight graffiti and trash. We returned to the hotel after dark but did not feel unsafe.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is easy to find, clean and comfortable. There are bicycles to check out and the rooftop deck is a wonderful place to relax. The staff is very helpful, they even have suggestions for restaurants. The location is close to the jazz venue. The building feels safe and secure.

Negative Reviews: Lift is very slow at busy times. Be patient!
Positive Reviews: All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent, don't let people on the street upset you, respect them and you get the same back. No problems. Roof top garden area is great at night, free bicycles and coffee in the morning, plus laundry facilities, all in a great neighborhood full of cool restaurants. Our king room was good sized, had a view and the doubled windows kept it quiet. We had a great stay!

Little gem in the city. Clean and comfortable the staff was extremely helpful and nice. We stayed the night before our cruise and the night we returned before our flight. Ate breakfast up on the roof. Walked to the space needle and the market. Great restaurant next door for breakfast, pizza around the corner.

Friendly staff, walking distance to great bars, restaurants, the ferris wheel, near to public transit. We had a queit room facing the courtyard that was small, but had a kitchenette. Very convenient and would definitely stay again!

Negative Reviews: The area was iffy, with lots of homeless and peeps you need to keep an eye on.. I wouldn't recommend wandering alone outside by yourself. Just make sure you aware of your surroundings.
Positive Reviews: The location was perfect for the space needle and the downtown attractions. Easy walking distance to restaurants and attractions. Hotel was clean, staff was helpful and knowledgeable. Price was good and roof top was awesome..

Negative Reviews: all good.
Positive Reviews: great location and friendly staff. Room wan very comfortable and clean. Nice touch with free bikes. Great spot for bars and restaurants. Roof terrace was great to relax.

Negative Reviews: Actually all was good no complaints.
Positive Reviews: Location was great you could walk to many places (Space Needle,shopping)&also bus stop right by hotel to go where you wanted .The room was great had fridge,microwave,coffee machine&snacks.Yes there is homeless ppl near by,but was not bother by any while waiting for bus where mostly hang out by the grocery store.Also went on 2rd Ave&saw many restaurant's.The front desk ppl all of them were very nice&helpful on giving directions on anything I ask.

Review Title: EPIC! Would do it again exactly the same.
Negative Reviews: Because our flight was in late 11pm  and out early 5am we had to get our own ride to and from the airport. Understandable but not exactly what I was told when I called.
Positive Reviews:
What a great location. 
We used the Lime bikes and scooters to get around town. Everything was a 10-15 minute ride. Space needle, ball park, ferry, pikes market, Capital Hill for great food and yummy ice cream at Salt & Straw.  So much fun. The bike lane on second street was wonderful. 
Great staff and clean. Yummy food very close. 
Very happy!

Review Title: Great hotel for a budget traveler
Negative Reviews: There are a lot of homeless people immediately outside of the hotel that appear to be on drugs, etc. It does feel a bit unsafe to walk near the hotel at night.
Positive Reviews: Staff was friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The A/C worked well. The hotel is in close walking distance to many restaurants and other attractions. Easy and affordable parking lot nearby.

Negative Reviews:
No free parking - the lot they work with is $30/day and down the street. They said to park in their unloading zone which is just the street parking to allow check in/pay for parking, however when we arrived there were no spots and it was not very clear where the unloading zone was. Had to walk with our luggage down the street.
Not the greatest area, many homeless people around.
No free breakfast.
Positive Reviews: Nice room, clean and comfortable. Friendly staff. About 10 minute walk to Pike Place which was convenient.

Review Title: Location convenient, marijuana stench, glad the lobby doors lock at night.
Negative Reviews: First room wasn’t fully cleaned and there was a dog fight happening in the “park” across the street. The staff found us a quieter room that had been cleaned but smelled horribly of marijuana. Getting to the hotel at 8:30 pm was challenging with the large numbers of mentally ill/drug addicted/unhoused people on every surrounding street.
Positive Reviews: Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. They helped us get a better room when the first room didn’t meet our basic needs.  Convenient to ferry terminal.

Review Title: I needed a convenient, comfortable stay between train station and ferry pier and was satisfied.
Negative Reviews: I chose it because I saw mention of or spoke to an agent that there was transportation services available to and from hotel. There was not, although staff assisted in calling me a cab. The benefit of looking on courtyard actually was awkward, as exposure from window was creepy. I do not like to be in a dark room and had to sleep with blinds closed because windows open to other windows facing.
Positive Reviews: Friendly front desk staff, comfy bed, okay location, clean

Negative Reviews: While a reasonable hotel it was very over priced based I assume on its great location. Also Coldplay were in town so I guess this pushed up the price.
Positive Reviews: Great location and freindly welcoming staff. Room was OK and felt very much like a Premier Inn standard. Clean and comfortable with basic facilities.

Negative Reviews: Location felt a bit insecure. A loud beeping sound was constantly happening in the morning and coming from the corridor or the lift which was very annoying and woke me up.
Positive Reviews: Great hotel near Seattle downtown, 10 min walking from West Lake station and close to all tourist attractions. Good wifi and comfortable rooms. Really nice staff and they have free coffee in the mornings.

Negative Reviews: No breakfast options, continental.
Positive Reviews: Great location. Exceptional staff. Excellent room, exceptional everything. Heading back next weekend!

Review Title: we are staying there again at the end of our cruise-that saids it all!
Negative Reviews: Expensive, no breakfast
Positive Reviews: great bed, great location, helpful staff

Negative Reviews: kitchenette is not well equipped but the staff will provide cutlery, crockery, toaster, whatever you request. ask at the main reception as housekeeping staff do not speak English
Positive Reviews:
clean, comfortable bed. very helpful friendly staff
easy walk to Pike Market and the Space Needle.

Negative Reviews: There are a number of people living on the street in this area, but there are also a lot of public works employees cleaning up and a hard-to-miss police presence. I never saw or experienced anything threatening nor dangerous.
Positive Reviews: This is a very cozy and clean boutique hotel within walking distance to the Space Needle, the Climate Pledge Arena, and Pike Place. My room was actually nicer than the photos. You can walk down to the harbor and stroll along the Elliot Bay Trail. The staff were kind, knowledgable, and accommodating. It was very convenient to have a kitchenette area so I did not need to go out to eat for every meal. There are small neighborhood grocery stores within a couple blocks and a Whole Foods about 8 blocks away.

Review Title: Would Stay Again For a Lesser Price
Negative Reviews: The elevator was very slow. Many homeless people around the surrounding blocks that we walked to get food and other leisurely items; only one asked for money.
Positive Reviews: I liked the location as it was close to restaurants, grocery stores, and Pierr 66. The room was clean and cozy; it also came with some snacks and the coffee was good. Staff was pretty friendly. Property is right across the street from a dog park; got to see lots of cute dogs. The roof access was nice to go chill or have a meal.

Review Title: Comfortable place close to tourist attractions.
Negative Reviews:
NA - I would like to address the “homeless” negative stuff from other reviews and figured this was the best place for others to see. This is completely prevalent in metropolitan cities and is NOT THE FAULT OF THE HOTEL. We were asked for money/change maybe 3 times. They left us alone, we never felt unsafe or bothered. We were here 6 nights and sure, there were some on 3rd and Bell, but they were not “lined up outside”. There are definitely areas where there are larger groups, but that is typically 3rd and Pike and 3rd and Pine due to those being high traffic tourist areas. 

If this concerns you, you can use 2nd Ave, 1st Ave or even 4th Ave and 5th Ave to Bell and just walk down the 1-2 blocks to the front of the hotel. If seeing people who are in a bad spot and just doing what they can to survive makes you uncomfortable and unsafe, that is unfortunate. But there are plenty of other places to stay for you to be more comfortable and ignore the issues with cities and society as a whole.
Positive Reviews:
tl;dr: comfortable place, walking distance to most things, would 1000% stay again if we visit the city again.

We stayed here for our super belated honeymoon trip, 6 nights total. We came during off season, so the price was super reasonable. 

We had the king suite with kitchenette and it was the perfect amount of room for us (1 large suitcase, 1 med suitcase, and 3 duffle bags/backpacks). The bed was somewhat firm, but not uncomfortable (but that’s what we like), the pillows a little soft for us but also not uncomfortable. 

There is not breakfast provided, but that is stated on here AND their website. Biscuit B*tch is right next door and AMAZING and has good prices. We had breakfast from them 3 times. 

The toilet paper is a little thin, but the staff were able to provide extra rolls, towels, and a dinnerware set for the kitchenette (we didn’t use housekeeping while staying which is why we requested the tp and towels). 

The hotel is close to everything. 10 minute walk to the space needle/mopop/chihuly, about a 5-10 minute walk to pike place market, and about 10 minutes to the west lake center (little shopping mall with a light rail station, highly recommend this stop if you are using the light rail from SEA-TAC to get here). 

We felt relatively safe, there were only like two times we felt uncomfortable, but only because it was our first night and we were hyper aware of our surroundings.

Negative Reviews:
The need want the most comfortable, but that's OK.

There's no food at the hotel, but we knew that going in. It didn't make a difference. 

We would recommend the Belltown Inn!
Positive Reviews:
The staff was AMAZING and so helpful!

The place was very clean. I loved that they had a small coffee bar set up and comfortable seating in the lobby. 

The loc was perfect! Easily walkable to the mail area attractions.

Negative Reviews: We didn't like that our Biscuit Bitch food was SO amazing, and we couldn't take it with us on our cruise! If we could have, we totally would have taken our breakfast with us. Make sure to get something from Biscuit Bitch. It's right beside the hotel.
Positive Reviews: As soon as we walked in, the front desk associate was so warm, welcoming, professional, and friendly. Based on her check-in process alone, we knew we were in for an enjoyable stay. We enjoyed Everything, and we would totally stay here again when in Seattle. Due to the location, staff, comfort, and cleanliness of the facility, you should book here!

Review Title: Value for money and great staff. Convenience to the cruise piers, restaurants and transportation.
Negative Reviews: There was no breakfast in the morning , just coffee.
Positive Reviews: The location is great, walking distance from The Needle, Pike Market and the Chihuly gardens. The staff was friendly and helpful. A snack was available in the room, the bathroom was clean, spacious and has all the products you would find in a larger hotel. Bed wAs comfy and clean. The room had everything I needed including an iron. Roof deck is a nice touch

Review Title: Good facility and staff, but location terrible albeit convenient.
Negative Reviews: The location was convenient but the part of Seattle where this hotel is located is terrible. It is very similar to many of the crime infested, drug dealing parts of Los Angeles. The facility is nice but there’s a good reason why the staff locks the exterior doors at 10 pm.
Positive Reviews: The facility was nice and it is located conveniently for trips to the boardwalk. The bicycles that the hotel makes available to guests is an exceptionally good idea.  Clean and the hotel staff were very helpful and professional.

Review Title: Good value with fun eateries around but need to plan ahead to keep yourself safe
Negative Reviews:
However, transients start to occupy on the streets in the downtown area soon after dark.  
Need to go for early dinner instead.
Positive Reviews:
The location was great with access to many restaurants nearby 
My room was clean and comfortable 
Easy to get to the cruise terminal with short shuttle ride 
12 pm check out time was very helpful for people taking cruises

Negative Reviews: No breakfast, but there are plenty of food places in the area so it wasnt a big deal.
Positive Reviews: Everything was perfect: walking distance to restaurants, public transport, rental car center and sights. Staff was outstanding, polite and helpful. Got the perfect room with an incredible view. Bed was comfy, too.

Review Title: Overall, it's a bang for your buck. I enjoyed my stay.
Negative Reviews: The only thing that I would say I didn't like was the fact that after a certain hour the dynamic of the neighborhood changes a bit. Due to the homeless population, it becomes more visible so, it may not be best to walk alone at night. There are plenty of great bars and restaurants one block up, but, you will experience this.
Positive Reviews:
The room was everything I needed and was very comfortable. 
I really liked my view and cleanliness was not an issue. 
The staff was very helpful and I enjoyed my interactions with them.
I also love that they provide laundry, breakfast, and free bike rentals to explore the city.

Negative Reviews: Wish breakfast was available. The neighborhood is a little sketchy, but that's not something this hotel could fix. But it might be worth a word to a city council member.
Positive Reviews:
The lobby and my room were clean and fresh. Great little courtyard. Wish breakfast was available; it would be nice to eat in the courtyard. The front desk staff were all excellent! Very friendly and helpful. 
The location is excellent. It's an easy walk to so many places of interest.

Review Title: Pleasant stay in a good central location
Negative Reviews: The hotel has no restaurant so one has to walk some distance to find a meal, dinner being easier than breakfast. Dreadful coffee is available in the rooms and reception - astonishing in Seattle. Although the place is clean I was irritated to find that my room had not been serviced by 3.00pm.
Positive Reviews: This hotel is in an excellent location and the rooms are well equipped and comfortable. Staff are consistently friendly and helpful at any time of day or night. There is a pleasant roof top seating area where one can read or chat etc.

Review Title: Cute/simple inn in a good location, with some downsides
Negative Reviews: Rooftop was closed for repairs, room location was not ideal (had to keep blinds closed the entire time because my window faced a busy sidewalk and was just up one floor), refrigerator was broken and froze all my stuff on the lowest setting, homeless folks harassed me right outside daily, bed was so-so, no breakfast or room service included (although Biscuit Bitch is awesome, it’s super busy all the time and there’s nowhere to really sit and eat.
Positive Reviews: Super nice staff, good location for walking around Belltown, easy to check in and out, good shower pressure in room, clean lobby and room.

Review Title: Stayed twice and would stay again
Negative Reviews: No fault of theirs- there are homeless up and down the avenue the hotel is located on.
Positive Reviews: Very comfortable. Staff is great. Logistically the location is good.

Negative Reviews: Sheets were uncomfortable and too many homeless people around the hotel
Positive Reviews: Location and staff were accommodating.

Negative Reviews:
Everything was good 
Except surrounding areas  homeless people
No problems with them
Positive Reviews:
Location ,,,staff Nicole gave us excellent service ,,information,, about everything 
Very good !!!!
Very accommodating location and staff. Very central to everything Seattle.

Negative Reviews: Too expensive.
Positive Reviews: Staff and location.
location was perfect, walking distance to everything fun. desk was always fully staffed, friendly, and helpful

Review Title: affordable, easy, and not too far away from the action
Negative Reviews: no complaints
Positive Reviews: great location & great staff

Review Title: Amazing stay! I absolutely loved it and would stay here again
Negative Reviews: This is not their fault at all, but this area in particular is overrun by homeless people. They are not aggressive or anything but does make it seems sketchy
Positive Reviews: The staff were so nice and accommodating and I really enjoyed the hotel mainly because it was super quiet and great location for anywhere you wanted to go

Negative Reviews: no stairs available
Positive Reviews: Great location and staff!

Review Title: Greatly Surprised.  Would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect.  Walking distance to so many attractions.  Or, the bus/light rail are excellent options.  The roof top view at night is spectacular.  The customer service at the registration desk was excellent.  Very knowledgeable staff, and gave us great info on nearby travel.

Review Title: Great choice for anyone on a cruise
Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Great location and staff.

Review Title: Great location and staff, but very thin walls.
Negative Reviews: Walls are very thin. Could hear the neighbors singing, screaming, stomping/walking, and the water running.
Positive Reviews: Great staff, great location, easy access to tourist spots and public transport.

Negative Reviews: Would have liked to be able get a snack and although there was free coffee in foyer it closed at 2 pm
Positive Reviews: Location and very helpful staff

Negative Reviews: Plumbing issues and lack of communication
Positive Reviews: Staff was friendly, good location, quiet

Friendly helpful staff.
Great location.

Loved our stay! All of the staff were super friendly and helpful, and the location was great and close to everything we wanted to do. Even though we didn't use them, there were some awesome amenities such as bikes you can use during the day that I thought was a thoughtful touch. Will definitely stay here again!
very friendly staff and great location

Review Title: A truly good experience. The front desk staff were truly attentive.
Positive Reviews:
The Belltown was in an excellent location! Everything  that I needed was walkable, I was departing on a cruise ship. The dock was around 4 blocks away
 The front desk personnel recommended a car service and made the arrangements.
The Belltown was a great experience and I have already recommended it to family.
Loved the location & the staff were very helpful.

Review Title: Great location and staff, no-frills stay in downtown Seattle

The neighborhood is a little sketchy a few blocks in either direction (not the hotels fault obviously!), just use your best judgment when venturing out after dark.

The Biscuit Bitch (the cute takeaway spot at street level) blasts music really early…we had a second floor room right over it and heard every song. 😳
Positive Reviews:
The staff was uniformly awesome!  They helped answer any questions I had about the city and let us keep our bags there for a few extra hours after checkout.  Great service, mahalo staff!  Complimentary coffee in the morning was nice bonus, and good call on the citrus water in the lobby.

The location is perfect for being a tourist in Seattle! The hotel is super close to the Space Needle and Pikes Market, both easy walks in opposite directions.

The rooms are smaller, but the king bed was nice. The older building allows for a lot of noise, so I’d recommend earplugs to get a decent nights sleep.

The room is clean, it comes with a small kitchen (sink, fridge, cups, snacks, coffee, and tea). In addition, the bed was so comfortable. I slept well through the night. The ac/heater worked fine. I really enjoyed the rooftop, especially since it's open 24 hours. I was vibing with a friend until 2AM on the rooftop. Lastly, Biscuit Bitch is next door so you can go there and grab a bite; that place is good. There is also a small grocery store close by.
