Really liked this hotel.  Rooms on smaller size, but very nice and comfortable.   Location was good, but there are some drug issues in area with people on the sidewalks a block away.  Had a great time, nice hotel, would definately recommend it.

Negative Reviews: In the area around the hotel were many people loitering on the sidewalk. They did not interact with me, but it made me a little uncomfortable.
Positive Reviews: They were able to help me get a ride from the airport. The room was comfortable. They had a rooftop sitting area and a courtyard that we’re both inviting. The location was walkable to pikes place.

Review Title: Great price for this clean hotel in a fantastic location.
Positive Reviews: clean, inexpensive and centrally located

Review Title: I would definitely recommend,  we walked most places as really central
Negative Reviews: Homeless people
Positive Reviews: Great location. Room was clean & had everything we needed. The area has a lot of homeless but apart from it been very sad it did not effect us.

Negative Reviews: Lots of homeless people around
Positive Reviews: Early check in and we got upgraded room and the location
Great people at the check in. Fabulous location. Super clean

Review Title: Great location, good value for money
Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Clean and comfortable, good location

Negative Reviews: I can't say I had an issue with anything...
Positive Reviews: It was in a great location and the room was super cute for me and my wife it was perfect. I just live across the water and need a weekend away and I would do it again and again.
location and cleanliness
Very Good clean and comfort hotel at the city center. Hotel should request to the City administration for more security of the area

I like the location and the decor. It was clean enough I thought the $50 deposit was ridiculous and the amount of time they hold it for even after you check out also was quoted a different price than what I was given when I checked in and had to step aside and spend time booking on bookings.com in order to get the rate that I was quoted over the phone.

Review Title: Not bad, but way too pricey.
Negative Reviews:
Expensive for what it is. $800 for 2 nights is way too much for a motel-style place. 

Local area is not somewhere you want to be after dark. I was worried my car would be vandalized.
Positive Reviews: Clean. Close to city center. Available.
Good walking location very quite room and the bed was very comfy.
Loved the kitchenette! bed was super comfy and it was perfect for our stay. The views from the rooftop were an awesome surprise!

Review Title: Great value, great location, we will return!
Negative Reviews: The neighborhood is busy, the traffic is noisy - typical city and nothing against the hotel.
Positive Reviews: The hotel uses minimal plastic, the water glass and coffee cup were glass and ceramic. The room was clean and comfortable, it’s a great location for jazz performances. The hotel offers free bicycles for guest use. The rooftop patio is large enough to be comfortable but small enough to be cozy. We got good recommendations for local dining options. A transit bus stop is across the street.

Negative Reviews: Can't say anything i didn't like. Enjoyed our stay
Positive Reviews: Everything Was clean and the view was perfect. Great location.

Negative Reviews: Nothing!
Positive Reviews: Very clean, very nice and excellent location.

Review Title: Fantastic location, clean and comfortable stay
Negative Reviews: Maybe a little dated
Positive Reviews: Great location and clean and comfortable
Location was great and very walkable to everything.  The room was very clean, bed was comfortable.  Rooftop area was amazing!

Proximity to attractions.
Clean
Comfortable

Review Title: Wonderful location, with great staff and room was excellent!
Negative Reviews: It did get a little confusing with the shuttle. We did sign up the night before for a certain time. Other groups that were larger than mine ( only 2 of us) kept getting the various shuttles. We did have to get a little pushy about this. However, still the overall experience of the stay was not ruined by this event.
Positive Reviews: Lovely room and roof top experience was awesome! Close to Pikes Market and the Cruise ship we needed to get to. It was nice having the shuttle from the hotel.

Review Title: convenient location, be comfortable with all situations of wealth.  Be kind and Enjoy Seattle!!  Seattle is a very eclec
Negative Reviews:
We experienced a group of people  having very heated arguments at 6 am in the morning across the street from entrance of Hotel.  appeared normal to others outside that early in the AM.  
go with the flow and pray no one gets hurt.
Positive Reviews: comfortable bed, not too far to walk to Pikes Market!!

Negative Reviews: nothing
Positive Reviews: room, location, very clean

Review Title: Staff were friendly and helpful! I love that they have bike lease which is a great way to navigate around!!
Negative Reviews: The homeless surrounding the hotel. Walking in they don’t really touch or hurt  you as long as you don’t make contact with them. As a tourist, it gives you a bad vibe especially when they are openly using drugs, selling or exchanging drugs on street. It is sad and concerning
Positive Reviews: The room is decent and clean. Location is close to every attraction.

Negative Reviews: Questionable persons hanging around.
Positive Reviews: Location great for getting to our cruise line.  Very clean.
Very satisfied! The room was very clean and very comfortable. Was visiting a friend, and the location was very close to them in terms of Uber/Lyft or public transportation.

Review Title: Cozy hotel, close to attractions we wanted to see and comfortable beds!
Negative Reviews: A lot of homeless on the streets, visible drug users and could be scary for families/kids.  We did not have any issues or altercations with anyone, and I realize that is out of the hotel’s control. Would stay here again as a couple traveling with other adults.
Positive Reviews: Excellent location, close to the areas we wanted to see. Clean, cozy and comfortable.
It was in a great location, super cute, clean and the rooftop was great.

Negative Reviews: nothing
Positive Reviews: There is a microwave and a small kitchen in the room, which were very convenient. The brightness of the room lighting made it feel like home, and I was able to relax and spend time comfortably.

Negative Reviews: To many people loitering around outside the hotel. I couldn't figure out how to turn on shower and house keeping didn't understand English
Positive Reviews: My room was nice. It was walking distance from attractions

Review Title: The inn was close to my venue, private, and nice.
Negative Reviews: The value left a little to be desired, as I ended up paying an extra $1000 over my original booking that was cancelled last minute by booking.com, but that's not the Inn's fault. The room was a little small, but for 1 person it was fine. Some instruction for working the AC/heat would have been nice.
Positive Reviews: The location for my venue was great. I had no issues with the hotel. It was clean and everything worked well for me. I loved the courtyard!

Negative Reviews: The only real bad thing that I can say about the hotel is that you could hear very clearly when somebody move in the bed or walk in the room from the floor above. Eventhough there's carpet in the room, you could hear every step and the bed frame made a noice everytime somebody got on and off the bed
Positive Reviews: The location of the hotel is very good, everything is just a few blocks away, you can either walk everywhere or ride everywhere. The room was bigger and better than expected, I've visited big cities before and the hotel rooms are really small, but in this case, it was not.

Negative Reviews: The opposite rooms are facing each other across  the courtyard and very close, so in order to have privacy you have to close the curtain.
Positive Reviews: Location, cleanliness, quiet. My window was facing the courtyard, so there was no noise at all. If you would prefer views of the street, you can ask for rooms facing out. I think I prefer the quietness

Negative Reviews: The toddler size toilets in the room. Seriously they are so tiny and really low to the ground. Hard on a taller person with a bad back when they are trying to sit down on it. Also the seat was smaller than the porcelain opening so you also had the cold porcelain on the back of your thighs when you sat down.
Positive Reviews: It is an older hotel but well kept and clean. Location was convenient to the places we were visiting. Beds were really comfortable as were the pillows. Loved the giant fluffy bath towels too!

Review Title: The hotel was clean and nice and the staff were very helpful.
Negative Reviews: Because we were able to check in a little early, we got a queen bed when I had reserved a king. Not a deal breaker, but I wish they had said something when we were offered a different room.
Positive Reviews: The location is great for walking to many attractions and shopping, etc. We had a day of sunshine and got to enjoy time on the rooftop terrace, which was great! The room was updated nicely and had a comfy bed.

Negative Reviews: Thin walls - I could hear other guests talking in the halls and the next door room. There were also sounds that seemed like someone was dragging furniture across the floor above my room.
Positive Reviews: Comfortable room. Good location, easy walking distance to most sights and activities (10-25min)

Negative Reviews: bed size a little small  and sheets felt old & pulled!
Positive Reviews: LOCATION GREAT.. BED A LITTLE SMALL.. cleaninness great

Review Title: Few days in Seattle before an Alaskan cruise!
Negative Reviews: Air conditioner was erratic, pillows were too bulky, the outside area had a large population of homeless and drug users.  With that said we were never approached or threatened, but it kept us on edge.
Positive Reviews: Reasonable price for the room.  Conventional location to Pike’s Street Market and shopping.

Review Title: Enjoyable city hotel in the center of Seattle for leasure and for work
Negative Reviews: The bathroom was a bit small.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is close (walkable distance) to main tourist attractions, with a bus stop nearby for many bus lines. The room is clean and have everything for a hotel room. Many free TV channels.

Negative Reviews: When I checked in you told me you would put a $100 hold on my credit card for incidentals. But what was really charged to my card were 2 charges: 1) the full price of the room plus $100 *AND* THE FULL CHARGE FOR THE ROOM ALREADY CHARGED TO MY CARD. So 2 charges are on my card, one for $637 and one for $737. And I am still waiting 4 days later for the $737 one to drop off since you confirmed to me on checkout that I had no incidental charges.
Positive Reviews:
The room and bathroom were clean and quiet. The beefy towels were a pleasant surprise. The location was perfect for all the places I walked to. 

I found the room decor to be dark and the carpet had a busy pattern. Not my favorite but more important to have everything clean.

Negative Reviews: Room was small and tight for two people to not feel like you’re on top of each other.
Positive Reviews:
Convenient location to Pier. 
Room was clean. 
Courtyard was inviting. 
Recycling was a pleasant surprise.

Negative Reviews: Seedy neighborhood but realize that's most of downtown Seattle. Bathroom very small
Positive Reviews: The location was fantastic. Bed was very comfortable . Rooftop area was great

Review Title: It was good for one night. If I had to stay longer I would have switched hotels due to smell.
Negative Reviews: The room smelled like the carpets had been shampooed with too much chemical and never fully dried. The room smelled slightly moldy and musty.
Positive Reviews: The price was fair for the room and it's a great location

Review Title: Nice location in downtown Seattle but the city has changed
Negative Reviews: Room a little small
Positive Reviews: Comfy king bed with nice rooftop. Easy to get to Pikes market

Negative Reviews: Need more parking spaces
Positive Reviews: Good location, walking distance to Pike place, all staff very helpful and friendly, i got discounts to compensate for the elevator that out of order that day.

Negative Reviews: You had to pay extra for parking (not the hotels fault though, this is everywhere in Seattle)
Positive Reviews: Staff was great, you could walk to everything which is very convenient as the parking situation is crazy!

Review Title: The Belltown Inn was the perfect place to stay for our first trip to Seattle!
Negative Reviews: The room was not large, but it was very nice and comfortable.
Positive Reviews: We really enjoyed staying at the Belltown Inn. There were a lot of restaurants in the area to choose from, and it within walking distance of so many of the Seattle attractions.  The front desk people were very helpful!

Negative Reviews: the cost of the rooms are a little pricey for the small room & outdated accommodations
Positive Reviews: Location is great for walkability & access to many restaurants and the ferry. staff was very welcoming and knowledgeable about where to eat.

Negative Reviews: The neighborhood is a bit sketchy, open drug use on the street, but we don’t go out much late at night and did not feel unsafe in the neighborhood. (We would definitely return to the hotel, though.) We stayed there twice and booked well in advance. By the time we got there the second time, rooms were still available at a much lower rate (!!!) and when we asked for an upgrade they actually charged us an upgrade fee of $25. The “King” room we got only had a bigger bed, but was not a bigger room in terms of square footage, so probably not worth it. Just sayin’. $304 for a two-star hotel?
Positive Reviews: Great location and superior staff. No kidding, very responsive, cheerful and efficient. This location is great if you’re visiting tourist spots, a lot of them are easily walkable, and the selection of restaurants just a block away is impressive: Mexican, Thai, Korean, Italian, pub food and more.

Negative Reviews: In the evening there seemed to be some dark spaces around the property that attributed to more homes less and people loitering, as a downtown property this is understandable but seemed to be more of a problem within the block around the hotel. If this is something that makes you feel uneasy just be cautious.
Positive Reviews: The property was in a great location and everything was very walkable, did not need to Uber once during our stay. The rooms were comfortable a little on the smaller side but good for the amount of time we stayed in our room

Review Title: Overall, we were very pleased with the Belltown Inn.
Negative Reviews:
Parking was a bit of an issue.
Elevator was painfully slow at times.
Positive Reviews:
The location was fantastic!
Room was well appointed.

Review Title: The hotel was good overall but the area not so much
Negative Reviews: It was near an area with so many people that were homeless or on drugs and it made us uncomfortable since it had no private parking.
Positive Reviews: We loved that it was definitely really close to many attractions, it was clean and a cozy spot.

Review Title: Clean and comfortable rooms within walking distance of downtown attractions
Negative Reviews: We were a little frustrated with the shuttle transportation to the cruise terminal that we reserved with the hotel. We booked for an 11am pickup and by 11:30 it was clear we would be waiting a very long time as the entire lobby was full of people waiting for the same thing. We ended up booking an Uber to assure we would make it for our checkin time.
Positive Reviews: Location was great and property/rooms were very clean. Bed was very comfortable.

Review Title: Enjoyable stay, would stay again during a future visit to Seattle.
Negative Reviews: One elevator for the whole hotel meant some hold ups in the morning when people were checking out. However since the hotel is not very tall, the stairs were okay for us. Just could be a longer wait for people who are not using or cannot use the stairs.
Positive Reviews: Location was very convenient to visit Seattle and to reach public transit. The hotel had good coffee in the morning and the rooftop access was nice. The room itself was good, clean, and comfortable. Temperature control worked fine.

Negative Reviews: The parking situation.
Positive Reviews: The room were really nice and the location was perfect.

Review Title: Avoid 3Rd Ave and go to restaurants on 1st and 4th
Negative Reviews: Should be two lifts. This hotel has a huge turnover of cruise guests, it’s always busy. Only seating for about 10 on roof and is a bit grubby. whole open spaces - roof and reception need to be spruced up. Huge amount of people go through this hotel. Some people might find the street people unsettling.
Positive Reviews: Location, our King room was good, bed was comfortable, shower good.

Negative Reviews: Access to parking was a little confusing, active construction made it a little difficult
Positive Reviews: Room was very cozy, very good deal for location. Proximity to waterfront and major attractions was excellent

Review Title: nice place to stay without a bunch of frills.
Negative Reviews: No a/c in hallways, only one elevator, price was high
Positive Reviews: great location and everything you need, had a/c in the rooms, free bikes to use.

Review Title: Very customer-oriented hotel with great location.
Negative Reviews: Paying for parking
Positive Reviews: Good location. Room was quiet.

Review Title: A lovely place to call home in Seattle
Negative Reviews: There were a lot of homeless people in the neighborhood. Harmless, but present. Parking was expensive, $30/night so I parked in a lot during the day and street parking at night.
Positive Reviews: Great location, it was clean and well maintained

Negative Reviews: elevator a little slow. no bottled water
Positive Reviews: Good location.  clean room.  Held our bags while we explored.

Review Title: First visit to Seattle,  great location to stay
Negative Reviews: The elevator is crazy slow
Positive Reviews: This hotel is really centrally located to most of the major attractions.  We were able to check in early and the room was comfortable.

Negative Reviews: one slow elevator
Positive Reviews: good location, clean, comfortable bed.

Negative Reviews: Homeless people, elevator didn’t work some of the time (but thankfully it worked when I needed to bring down my luggage) and that someone pulled the fire alarm at 4 in the morning during my stay, the sheets also were scratchy.
Positive Reviews: Location was good, lots of things were within walking distance. I also appreciated the fridge and microwave. The room was also very clean

Review Title: Awesome stay! Definitely will be back again
Negative Reviews: The only thing that concerned me was the lack of parking.
Positive Reviews: It was located in the center of town. I was within walking distance to everything. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Review Title: More pros than cons. Would stay again.
Negative Reviews: Walls are thin, could hear every footstep. Parking permit can get pricey if you’re staying longer than 2 nights.
Positive Reviews: Location was great. Rooftop view is very nice. Room was comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The parking is inconveniently located half a block away from the hotel with very few places to stop at check in. When I opened the door to my room I was hit with a strong smell of mold and smoke-even though it was a non smoking room. When I opened the window to let fresh air in it was so loud outside that we had to shut it to sleep. It is like you can hear everything that happens inside and outside the hotel. If you are unlucky enough to be place above the Biscuit place get ready to be woken up early by them yelling orders nonstop out of the window. I don't even want to start on how dirty and scuffed all the furniture was. The bedding was so gross. I am lucky I brought a blanket with how nasty the cover blanket was. The mattress was so uncomfortable. If you want to pay mid city prices for middle of know where motel quality then stay here. The location is the only positive. We were never asked about our stay or helped either.
Positive Reviews: The hotel was very centrally located. The shower pressure was excellent. The bathtub was a good size. The complimentary coffee in the morning was alright. This is one of the few hotels I have stayed at that included parking in the cost of the room.

Review Title: Good location with exceptionally friendly, helpful staff
Negative Reviews: Nothing important.  The lighting in the rooms could be a little brighter.
Positive Reviews: The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Every time we went by the front desk they would greet us and ask if we needed anything or directions.  There are a number of restaurants within easy walking distance.  The coffee in the lobby was exceptionally good.  Public transportation options were very good with a number of buses stopping nearby and the Linc a 15 minute walk. The Space Needle is only a  fifteen minute walk as is the Pike's Market (in the opposite direction).   The hotel has a shuttle to the cruise port.

Review Title: Great Stay Close to Cruise Terminal
Negative Reviews: The room faced a wall and was very dark.
Positive Reviews: Very good location, close to the cruise terminal and within walking distance to a lot of shopping, bars and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and super quick at replying to emails answering all my questions.

Review Title: Great central location to see the city.
Negative Reviews: Blankets on the bed are a little thin.
Positive Reviews: The location is unbeatable. It’s so central to all the main tourist things, and tons of great restaurants and bars. The staff was also pleasant. There are free(?) bikes that can be used by guests and coffee in the morning. Felt very welcoming.

Negative Reviews: Small bath. Lacked shower pressure. No view. On the corner of the most dangerous place in the United States.  Doors locked at night with a security guard. One Elevator that was slow. Over priced
Positive Reviews: Close to the cruise port. Free coffee all day. Room was clean and comfortable. Free bag of cheese itz. The Biscuit Bitch Breakfast restaurant is next door with good food and a fun atmosphere (take out only). Roof top viewing lounge. Let us check in early.

Negative Reviews: would have liked either a fire pit or heat lamp on roof top. pillows on bed were terrible. would have liked Tv in lobby with a small breakfast/coffee room in the morning
Positive Reviews: location very accommodating staff

Negative Reviews: The location is not good. Drug addicts are roaming outside the hotel. Also, they do not have any water bottles provided to us. The room is very small
Positive Reviews: The staff were good and the rooftop view was good

Review Title: I’m sure the majority of rooms are lovely, but we just got very unlucky with the room we stayed in.
Negative Reviews: Man…our room location was awful. First floor because we had a pet which is totally understandable, but our one window faced an alley way. So we had to deal with closed blinds all the time to avoid people (often unsavory characters) and cars driving by. But the worst part…trash day!! Our room smelt so bad we went out to get room spray just to be able to stomach the room.
Positive Reviews: LOVED the location of the hotel itself. Staff was incredibly friendly.

Negative Reviews: Our door didn’t close fully on its own so we actually had a worker coming around doing “safety checks” one of the two nights and she was the one who told us our door wasn’t fully closed. That was a little unnerving but once we gave it a good push it was fine.
Positive Reviews: It was a great location and the staff was really nice. The free coffee and flavored water in the morning in the lobby was such a great perk!!
Close to the market, space needle and Climate change arena. Friendly staff. Lots of places to eat nearby. Light rail to the airport is about a 10 min walk.

Negative Reviews: very expensive per night
Positive Reviews: location, staff, facilities

Negative Reviews: I liked everything!!
Positive Reviews: It's location is perfect for walking to Pikes and concert venues.  The open rooftop is amazing 👏 But the Customer Service (Tristan) was one of the key people who added a little more spunk to the trip! So friendly and fun 😁❤️ I have seen many reviews about homeless people but it wasn't a problem be friendly and keep it moving there should be no problems. We were two ladies and walked from a local Karaoke Bar and had no problems way after midnight. Just be cautious of surrounding 🍻

Very nice hotel with wonderful staff in the Belltown area of Seattle. Walkable area, loads of varied eateries around for lots of choices, near to Pike Place and the Space Needle. Affordable with a great location.  Will be back!

great location - super easy for the majority of the big ticket places to visit. 
close to lots of bars and great eating spots. 
staff super friendly and helpful from start to finish! credit to them!
Location, parking and we felt very safe. Staff was very gracious and helpful.
Location was perfect! Parking was convenient, and the staff was very helpful! Definitely will stay here again!

Negative Reviews: Toilet paper is too close to the toilet!!
Positive Reviews: Its a fantastic hotel. Great location.  So close to the space needle and pike market.  Staff are so nice. And helpful.

Negative Reviews: Although, it was a very clean room there was not natural light which is always nice.  Next time we book a room,  I will ask if they have a room with natural lighting or more update lighting.
Positive Reviews: The room and bathroom was very clean.  They had coffee downstairs in lobby area from 6am-2pm. Location has a dog park across from the Belltown Inn and a Market near dog park and a lot of homeless people were gathered around, but not bothering anyone to my knowledge.

Negative Reviews:
Wish parking was included in the price. I went around and around the streets near the inn to find a parking spot before checking in. I had to pay 30 USD for off site parking which was only a minute away ( the distance was super convenient) but I think the price was too steep especially when it comes out to be 45 dollars CAD. I think it should be max 10 USD. 

Also both days there was vacuuming on the main floor between 8 and 9 am - I think this could be done later than 10 am so that guests are not woken up by the noise :)
Positive Reviews:
Location was great - was able to walk everywhere
friendly staff - answered all the questions!
Things were replaced in time - e.g. coffee, toiletries
Good cable channels

Negative Reviews: Parking is less than a block awya, not a huge deal but it was a little inconvenient. Have to pay to park.
Positive Reviews: Great location in downtown. Had a shuttle to thr cruise terminal and thr driver was friendly. Very close to everything.

Review Title: Great value with central location to jazz venue
Negative Reviews: No fault of the hotel, the neighborhood has graffiti. Some street noise.
Positive Reviews: Great location for local jazz event. Bus stop within 500 feet. Quick and courteous check in. Bothe the lobby and the room were clean and comfortable. The hotel feels safe and secure, the doors are locked after 10;00 pm. Free coffee available in the lobby at 7:00 am.

Negative Reviews: everything was good! minor thing would be only having one elevator.
Positive Reviews: location was awesome, walkable to most places, had parking, clean, comfy beds, rental bikes, security at night

Negative Reviews: Little bit more space would be nice but honestly for the price it was good with us.
Positive Reviews: The location was phenomenal, the rooms were small but very clean and comfortable. Plenty of room for myself and my husband. They had coffee and water available in the lobby and even stored our luggage for us. We were able to check in early too which was hugely nice for us after a long overnight flight. I was pleasantly surprised by this quaint little place and would definitely stay again. Especially for walkability to pike place and price.

Review Title: It did what it had to
Negative Reviews: The cost for a small queen room was very high. The the location was heavily populated with homeless. A little uncomfortable for early morning walkers as we are. By 10 am this is no longer a concern
Positive Reviews: Location, staff, we’re great. They told us where nearby restaurants were. They set us up with transportation to our ship.

Review Title: great place for a short stay and for solo travellers on a budget
Positive Reviews: Perfect location, you can walk everywhere, the staff were so helpful with dinner & activity recommendations and great value for money given the location - easy access to sights & public transport.
Loved the rooftop sitting area. Great location, walking distance to several restaurants. Employees were all friendly.
Great location, everything in walking distance. Rooftop is breathtaking and you can even bring snacks and a drink. Staff was very friendly. Perfect location for a city trip!

Excellent desk staff. Inn is well located on a major bus route from center city. It is fairly close to Link the transit line to the airport. It is good walking distance to the waterfront. There are a lot of restaurants very close to the Inn.

Review Title: Nice place in a good location
Negative Reviews: Area sketchy at night, but it is a city, and I had no problems.
Positive Reviews: Location is great.  City center and Pikes is walkable.  Some good restaurants and coffee near by.  Free bikes at the hotel to use.  Friendly staff.  Not stuffy.

Negative Reviews: A strong smell maybe from detergent
Positive Reviews: Close to main attractions, drinks are accessible, staff Trystan very nice and friendly
The location was great, truly within walking distance to most tourist attractions. Great selection of restaurants around, too! The staff were very helpful and accommodating.

Negative Reviews: at night lots of homeless in the area, but that’s not uncommon anymore everywhere
Positive Reviews: good location close to downtown and lots of restaurants nearby. the staff was kind and helpful

Review Title: It was a great experience. This was my second stay at this Hotel.
Positive Reviews: I loved the decor, location staff and the cozy vibe. Walking distance to restaurants sites. Staff was super professional  and welcoming.

The location was perfect,  walkable to everywhere we wanted to go. Staff at front desk was amazing,  especially Miss Melba. The view from the roof deck at night was gorgeous,  a lovely place to sit and have a beverage.

Negative Reviews: Nothing I didn't like. I loved it there! Especially the rooftop.
Positive Reviews: Best stay ever! The staff went above and beyond for me. Centrally located and full of restaurants.

Great staff, I had issues over at hotel max and ended up at The Belltown, they took great care of me. Great location close to great dinner and breakfast options. Would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling

Negative Reviews:
small and old rooms
ton of homeless people
$35 per night for parking was outrageous for what it was. unprotected cars unhoused people doing drugs inbetween cars
Positive Reviews: staff was helpful, walkable to major points in the city. rooms were small but clean

Negative Reviews: Open air parking is available but it's across the street and set back which some people may not like. Bed seemed smaller than it was supposed to be.
Positive Reviews: Very clean, friendly staff.

Negative Reviews: Across from a park that has a lot of homeless people and loud noises at night that you can hear from the room.
Positive Reviews:
Comfortable rooms and kind staff.
Good local coffee served in the morning.
Lots of good channels on TV.
Nice hot water.

Review Title: Nice place, easy walking distance to Pike Place
Negative Reviews: It did have a kitchenette, but there were no plates, bowls, silverware, or even something to clean the two glasses that were there. Plan to have your own kitchen wares if needed.
Positive Reviews: Staff is helpful, everything was clean and tidy, generally a nice place to stay.

Review Title: Very comfortable and a good value in Seattle!
Negative Reviews: I agree with all the other posts about the concrete park across the street. We saw drug deals happening at all hours as well as prostitution and people smoking from glass pipes (which I assume was crack). The location was great to walk to different tourist attractions iduring the day, but we didn’t feel comfortable walking after dark and we were thankful we didn’t have our kids with us. The hotel was fantastic and it’s unfortunate for them that the city is letting this happen across from their establishment. We only stayed one night before a cruise and the hotel was within a couple miles of the port.
Positive Reviews: The location was nice and the staff was really friendly.

Negative Reviews: Convenient
Positive Reviews: Location staff

Negative Reviews: Slow elevator, parking was badly expensive and the surrounding area was not the most pleasant of experiences being exposed to a sad side of life. However overall the haven of the hotel and the activities overcoming that negative side  was not too hard
Positive Reviews: Great location for the market and great restaurants. the room really was great, big enough for my needs and housekeeping did a wonderful job.

Negative Reviews: There's absolutely nothing wrong with the hotel per se, except maybe the slow-ish single elevator, but that can't be helped. The other thing is that sometimes it's a little sketchy outside (may have seen someone a block away get bonked with a cane for being obnoxious) but that's city life.
Positive Reviews: Great location for restaurants and night life. Always very clean. Quiet. We enjoyed having a kitchenette in our queen room, as well as the microwave and refrigerator. Bathroom was also very clean and in proper working order, which is huge for me. Quickly becoming my favorite hotel in Seattle.

Review Title: Very friendly staff and convenient location.
Negative Reviews: Really just the slow elevator
Positive Reviews: Convenient location. Close by bakery/cafe for breakfast. Easy walk down to the water (doable back up though steep 🙂).  Huge rooftop deck. Everything in the room that we need.

Negative Reviews: As a business traveler, I need space to hang up clothes. The small closet space was made even smaller by the stuff the hotel put in there.
Positive Reviews: The location was within walking distance of so many things and amidst many great food options. The room was simple, but comfortable. The bathroom had plenty of shelf space for toiletries.

Negative Reviews: On our approach to the Inn mid afternoon we felt uncomfortable because there was open drug use and several drug users on local streets. however streets towards the space needle  and ferry port were clear.
Positive Reviews: Spacious rooms with good storage, good range of restaurants nearby. Location good for Vancouver Island ferry and tram to SeaTac airport

Negative Reviews:
Having minimal kitchen facilities was a bonus however, there was a coffee maker in the room but no kettle. Although there was a microwave I'd prefer a kettle to heat up the water. Some crockery would be beneficial such as a couple of plates/bowls. 
A lot of homeless near to the hotel but there's not much the hotel can do about that. They genuinely didn't bother us as we walked by but it was a bit smelly. This was only in one section so when you walk in another direction it was fine. 
The room has a pull down blind but it needs a Venetian or vertical blind so you can have some light and privacy at the same time.
Positive Reviews: Staff were excellent even before we arrived I sent a few queries via email and I received a prompt and clear response. They were the same when we arrived, extremely pleasant and helpful from keeping our bags as we arrived early to explaining where to go to eat and that we could bring food and drink back to the hotel. Very comfy bed, pillows and fluffy white towels. Small basic kitchen facilities for those who want to use it. Safe, ironing board, iron and a reasonably powered mini hair dryer in the bathroom.

Negative Reviews: The elevator was a bit slow. The shower didn't have a handheld spout.
Positive Reviews:
The room was comfortable and spacious enough to not trip over our suitcases (4).
The staff was courteous and helpful. The recommendations for food were spot-on!

Negative Reviews: Slightly rough area, with some dodgy characters around, but security guard at night ensured you felt safe through all hours of the night. Only complaint regarding this area, but still worth staying outside of this.
Positive Reviews: Great location, within 15/20 minutes walk of all major downtown Seattle attractions. Parking across the road was great, and accommodation was very nice and clean for the price. Would recommend to a friend

Negative Reviews: Of course, always wish it could be cheaper!
Positive Reviews:
location was great, in that we could walk to everything - just like the tagline says. the people lingering outside in the immediate area surrounding, though, made us feel a little less than safe...

It was nice having the snacks included in the room, as well as the coffee in the lobby. Also, the kitchenette was a really nice feature, the additional sink was great!
Good location, room was good. The elevator stopped working during our stay but only for the morning we were leaving.

Beautiful view from the roof top ~ very relaxing. Rooms and Lobby very clean.
Great Location ~ about 13 min walk to Mopop & about 10 min walk to Pike Market.

I did appreciate that when we arrived in the evening, there was a gentleman there to open the door for us.  kudos.....keep moving forward!
Positive Reviews: the price was good.  the location was perfect for walking to pike place market and space needle.  the room was comfy and clean with good coffee in room with microwave and fridge and sink.

As they say, walking distance to everything, this hotel is situated halfway between Space Needle and Pikes Place Market. I didn’t get a chance to use them but the bikes they have look they would have been pretty fun.  Beds were extra comfortable. Room was quiet even though we were right on the street

Positive Reviews: spotlessly clean and good facilities Great roof-top views and for relaxing

Negative Reviews: Nothing.

Review Title: excellent place to stay while exploring downtown Seattle!
Negative Reviews: nothing comes to mind.
Positive Reviews: very clean, everything was ok good working order and up to date. location was nice too, walking distance to the pier, space needle, etc.

Negative Reviews: The amount of homeless people outside the hotel is crazy! My sister and I didn’t feel safe for two blocks surrounding the hotel until we got to a more public scene. The drug use is outrageous!

Great location, walkable to everything, space needle, pikes...   Nice rooms, comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The only knock we had on the hotel is the prevalence of homeless folks I'm the area (they could be noisy at night) and that's not the hotel's fault.

the property is super close to Pikes Market. about a 15min walk. the hotel has a rooftop that attracts a lot of sunlight. you can def see the Space Needle from a tiny corner of the hotel roof. they have an amazing Vietnamese Restaurant right across the street. best Pho I’ve ever had!!
Excellent location. 10 minute walk to Pike Place, tons of restaurants/bars nearby, and friendly staff!

Review Title: A gem of a hotel with reasonable prices, great staff and in a good location.
Negative Reviews: Nothing. It was excellent
Positive Reviews:
The location is perfect, close to the main attractions such as Pikes market,  the Space Needle, and the waterfront.
Staff were attentive and assisted with every request in a professional manner. 
Restaurants and grocery stores are a few minutes away.
Staff very nice. The location is great right by bars and restaurants. 10 minute walk to Space Needle, Pike Market. Use 2nd and 1st to walk to areas.

Negative Reviews: I didn't like that I couldn't stay longer!
Positive Reviews: Location was perfect. It was a 10-15 minute walk everywhere (Pike Place, Pioneer Square, Space Needle, etc). Cool bars and food nearby (Shorty's, Some Random Bar which has 25% off delicious food on Mondays, Biscuit B!tch right outside for breakfast). Staff was super nice, cold water dispenser in the lobby. Over all fantastic hotel for Seattle visitors who don't mind walking a bit. Public transit very close too.

Review Title: Great and small hotel for visiting Seattle. Friendly. Would stay here again. Good value for money.
Negative Reviews: Needed a few more chairs on the roof terrace....but apart from this, great hotel and would stay again.
Positive Reviews: Great location as near to downtown (easily walkable to market/shops/ferry) while being in an interesting area itself with restaurants just around the corner. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Free bikes (did not use them but great to have them). Roof terrace was available; and easy laundry facilities in the hotel. Cold water and coffee always available. Nice to be in a smaller 'non-chain' hotel.

Review Title: Convenient location to City University with plenty of dining options.
Negative Reviews: The Belltown location has a lot of street people around. There was a fake parking attendant dressed in "security" clothing in the parking lot who tried to swindle me out of $30 for parking. I never carry cash, so I went to the machine to pay and then a person drove up and told me that the man was an imposter. The lot does not have an attendant, so beware. Also, several people were hanging out at the store across the street drinking alcohol and smashing the bottles on the street. It was unpleasant.  The situation is not so bad during daylight hours. The hotel room did not have a deadbolt nor a door swing bar guard. I felt uncomfortable without the extra lock, so I used my person door alarm.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is comfortable and close to my destination. The rooms were small, but big enough for a solo traveler or a cozy couple. The bathroom was neat and clean and the room has a big TV, a microwave, coffee pot and a refrigerator.  The hotel offers bicycles for visitors and a nice rooftop deck. There are several restaurants around the hotel which are convenient, be cautious venturing out alone after 9 p.m.

Review Title: Only stayed one night but overall a pleasant experience.
Negative Reviews: Hotel was a little dated looking and noise from the adjoining rooms traveled through the walls easily.
Positive Reviews: Front desk staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful. We needed a recommendation for a nearby restaurant and the perfect one was recommended. When I checked my charge bill I noticed that I was double charged for the room. I emailed the manager who promptly contacted me and the removed the erroneous charge. Great service on their part!

Negative Reviews: Like any large city, Seattle has a significant homeless population, which makes walking trips outside the hotel disconcerting.  The high volume of cruise ship guests means that the lobby is hectic on Saturday as arriving guests wait for rooms to be checked out and cleaned before they can move in.
Positive Reviews: This is a cute little property just a few blocks from the cruise line piers and within walking distance of a number of nice restaurants.  The rooms were small but comfortable and staff are responsive to guest requests.

Review Title: Good location but NO PARKING AT ALL. This must be removed from the hotel description.
Negative Reviews: This hotel does NOT offer any parking despite the description in the ad. They will charge you extra money with tax on top to park in a location away from the hotel. Anyone can book this for themselves for cheaper than what the hotel charges. Also, they wanted 30 dollars per night for parking when it is actually free to park outside the hotel overnight. The manager blamed it on booking.com.
Positive Reviews: The hotel was in a good location and the rooms were really clean and comfortable.

Negative Reviews: Blankets were thin, and uncomfortable. There was no clear indication of what was available to us to make up a ‘kitchenette’, and when I asked what was available the manager said ‘stuff like that’ rather than actually answering my question and offering options. So we were never aware of cooking supplies, or hot plates that could have saved us some money on dining out. If you wanted to smoke, you had to walk down the street, and take your chances with the local crackhead population. I saw some of the most violent things in my life, standing outside this hotel to smoke….. there’s no security, but the manager will chastise you in the lobby in front of everyone, if he thinks you were standing a little too close to the safety of your hotel, to smoke a joint. The rooftop is a lounge space of maybe ten feet, too far from the buildings edge to actually see anything nearby, just a view of construction cranes and the sides of skyscrapers nearby. They wanted 65$ for a ride to the airport, and that was apparently ‘a deal’-spend the 6$ and take the LightRail instead. The elevator takes ten minutes to show up, and if the housekeeping is making their rounds, they’ll force you to wait for the next one, and push their way into the elevator- carts and all. I work at a hotel in my city, and i know that’s not how you operate in hospitality. I don’t think I’ll ever visit Seattle again, but If I’m passing through- I certainly won’t stay here.
Positive Reviews: The price, and proximity to pikes place, I also enjoyed the tiny balcony and water pressure. ‘Biscuit bitch’ cafe next door, you can order from your room and take it back, instead of eating in the cold.

Negative Reviews: Breakfast included with breakfast facilities would be nice
Positive Reviews: Excellent location and fantastic staff!

Review Title: Really enjoyable space. With amazing water pressure.

Negative Reviews: The comforter on the bed needed to be changed out.
Positive Reviews: Its a very reasonable little place. Clean and friendly and a good value.

Negative Reviews: The room was small as was the bed, but other than that our stay was nice.

Negative Reviews: The room was dark and a bit cramped. There was a long dark hair in the sheets.

Negative Reviews: Rooms are a bit small
Positive Reviews: Is my favorite place to stay is Seattle. The rooms are clean, very comfortabe, with nice ammenities (like real glasses and cups in room) Staff was helpful/friendly.

Not sure how the politicians let it get to this but they should be ashamed.  Hadnt been to Seattle in several years, but what a disaster.  Sorry, but wouldnt recommend bringing children or young adults to this hotel, as a result

I would definitely stay again and look forward to next year when visiting again.

Hotel had fridge, coffee maker and microwave all spotless so great housekeeping.

Positive Reviews: Thanks to the staff for answering to my request and changing my room which was much more better.

Negative Reviews: The parking option was fine it is downtown Seattle.  But designated parking would've been better with like a guard or a gate. I bought a parking pass for one night and got charged $100 when I was told the pass was like $30 so that's annoying.
Positive Reviews: Easy to walk anywhere. We thought check in was 3 and it was 4 and they still let us check in early. Gave us options of what kind of room we would want. One on the street versus one facing the courtyard. And was honest about what each one would be like which was helpful. Staff was incredibly friendly and easy to work with.

Negative Reviews: If you have a car add $35 per day to hotel price.  That's what you'll pay to park across the street.  Not bad but if comparing to other hotels that have valet parking included in price it factors in.  Walking a few of the streets around hotel can be a little sketchy (but that's typical Seattle/big city reality these days).  I'm a pretty intimidating guy but there were a few dudes measuring me up for sure.
Positive Reviews: Not a bad price.  Walking distance to touristy stuff.  Nice and friendly staff.  Clean.

The roof patio was a great place to watch the sun set and enjoy a morning coffee.

Negative Reviews: Wish they had a second elevator
Positive Reviews: Great staff and comfortable room. Enjoyed the rooftop patio.

There is free parking between certain times at night, so if you plan on being out in the day and only parking by the hotel at night you wouldn’t have to worry about this. But I’m overall not complaining because we were in the heart of Seattle.
Positive Reviews: My friend and I traveled to Seattle for a girls weekend and chose this hotel because it was a great price. We thought our room was very clean, the staff was very friendly, and we overall had a really nice stay.

Positive Reviews: The room stayed nice and cold throughout the stay and the bed was very comfortable. The staff that helped me out was very personable as well as being very helpful throughout getting checked in and throughout the stay in the case of us needing a wine bottle opener

Review Title: Nice hotel, but sketchy area with lots of homeless/drug users around.
Negative Reviews: There was so many homeless people in the area. Right outside our window was people sleeping on the bench and on the sidewalk. There was a chicken place on same side of street that had gangs of people hanging around the front door. It was a very uncomfortable feeling walking through them. We had to park in a parking lot that we were told was secure, however, there was human feces along the wall on the ground and garbage everywhere, along with the homeless people there. We were told there were cameras, which there were, but that really wouldn't do much good after the fact. I would say that the parking is not a secure lot. There wasn't anywhere to eat close by except for one place across the street which was Pho and we don't eat that. I would not recommend this hotel for the reason of the homelessness in the area.
Positive Reviews: The hotel was clean and the air conditioning worked great, which is very important to us. The staff was excellent. They were very friendly and informative.

Negative Reviews: There were additional fees like parking and deposit. It wasn’t much though.
Positive Reviews: It was very clean, staff was super nice!

Negative Reviews: Single elevator so sometimes a longish wait for one.
Positive Reviews: Comfortable room. Windows which open. Rooftop lounge. Helpful staff. Nice eating places nearby. Close to places of interest to us.

Review Title: Very friendly staff, older building but clean. We would consider stay again.
Negative Reviews: The area around the property has a large homeless population and it can be a little overwhelming to some. The underground parking around the corner can be a pain for bigger vehicles and is available on a first come, first serve basis (I believe). I’d like to see it be available as part of the reservation if needed. It is a little expensive but it’s the city and parking overall isn’t cheap. If it is full be prepared to leave your vehicle in an outdoor pay parking with lots of activity all around.
Positive Reviews: In the heart of Seattle and easy walking to all amenities. It’s an older building and yet for us we found it was clean and our room was as well. Our stay was very quiet and the staff was extremely helpful. It has a very nice roof top patio. The underground parking was available for us, so I was happy.

Negative Reviews: There was no kettle in the room initially, only coffee machine. I was tired and hesitant to ask receptionist first, but asked in the end and they provided without issue. Last day they forgot to restock tea bags in my room and I had to go down and ask.
Positive Reviews:
This hotel was a bit expensive than what I usually book, and it showed in daily room service. I appreciated complimentary tea - black and camomile, as I don't drink coffee. They also provided body lotion besides shampoo and conditioner. 
My room was facing street side, but the glass door was blocking the noise. The heater was functional and I could warm myself up in the evening. 
They provided kettle and cutlery when I asked.

Review Title: Very pleasant staff and clean room.
Negative Reviews: We had a King room.  The bed was comfortable, but the room was very small.  The only elevator was broken and the roof top area was closed.  There isn’t a lot of breakfast choices in the area.
Positive Reviews: Room was clean and staff very grit and helpful!

Review Title: It was fine but would spend a little more for a better experience next time.
Negative Reviews: The rooms are small and many look out onto the opposite wall across a small courtyard area. If you stay here, make sure you get a room that faces the front or side streets. The location is next to a block that is uncomfortable to walk through because of the street people, but it can be avoided easily enough once you figure it out.
Positive Reviews: Staff was great, rooms were clean, and the beds comfortable. Coffee in the lobby in the morning is good.

Negative Reviews:
Incredibly noisy and loud. There was not a single hour of silence in the place after midnight. The staff on at night were so loud. I was on the ground floor and got almost no sleep. I don’t mind noise during the day but after 10-11pm really is a lot. 

For 400+ a night I was a little annoyed.
Positive Reviews: Location was good. Easy to walk to from the ferry. Rooms were clean and bed comfy.

Negative Reviews: view from room of alley
Positive Reviews: staff and clean rooms

Negative Reviews: Had a city view room and I did not like that opening the curtain exposed my whole room to the street outside, I like waking up with natural light
Positive Reviews: Quiet room, comfortable bed, kind staff, easily walkable to a bunch of stuff, good amenities, rooftop seating, affordable, perfect for a solo traveler

Negative Reviews: the location - it’s hard to ignore the homeless situation in the area. I wish more can be done to alleviate the conditions that people were in. It felt uncomfortable to walk around the evening. Try not to stay out late (we tried to get to our room before 8 pm). Other than that it was a good stay.
Positive Reviews: professional staff, good room for the price (clean and comfortable) and the laundry machine)

Negative Reviews: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION.  You take your life in your hands when you are walking to and from this place.  It is in the very heart and confluence of drug addicts, mentally ill, and homeless.  Belltown is located on 3rd and Bell.  We were told NOT to walk to the Belltown on 3rd street.  HUH???  The evening front desk person even kidded us by saying:  “Oh, you made it alive.”  We had a seriously mentally ill man with a knife or weapon swing at us as we approached the Belltown upon returning to our room from a Mariner evening baseball game.   We were lucky in that we mainly walked with the crowds as we were leaving a Mariner game (around 11:00 PM on a Friday evening) and it was heavily attended by people staying in the various hotels in downtown Seattle.  Unfortunately, Belltown is a little further north of the downtown area and we were by ourselves for several blocks.  Snake Plisken “Escape from New York” would have felt at home here.  This section of town looks like a 3rd world country.  Downtown Seattle is a mess!!!  What’s tragic is this isn’t a bad hotel to stay at, unfortunately, it is NOT safe in and around the surrounding area.  I would never expose children to this area of town.  If I could turn back the hands of time, my review would probably have been very favorable pre-covid.  Now this place is a disaster.  Caveat Emptor!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Positive Reviews: Two of the front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  The night staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful and gave us some ice for our room.  When we checked out the front desk girl was not very friendly and when I asked for a receipt she said she couldn’t give me one since I had made the reservation through Booking.com and only they could  give me a receipt.  Huh??  Never heard that one before.  It’s been a day and a half since we left and I still don’t have a receipt and my payment is still pending on my card.  Yikes.

Negative Reviews: Didnt feel safe the location of the hotel. Had a homeless man digging in the garden bed outside the hotel with a empty liquor bottle when we arrived. The bus stop across the hotel has a big population of drug users/homelessness. We parked in the lot across the hotel that was recommended. Being street wise we took everything out of car we didnt want to lose. Thankful we did as the next morning a SUV with colorado plates 3feet from out car had 2 windows smashed out. Worried about my car all night.
Positive Reviews: The staff were super friendly and helpful arrived early they got me into a room and waves the check in fee.Our room was small but comfortable.

Review Title: Unfortunately I wouldn’t stay here again - but that is due more to the location and surrounds, than the hotel itself. Wh
Negative Reviews:
The location is right in the heart of the homeless district so there are a lot of homeless around the street corners which is quite intimidating.
The hotel is pretty tired
The air con in my room was super noisy
Positive Reviews:
The staff were very helpful
The bed was comfortable
The shower had great pressure
The rooftop terrace is great on a sunny afternoon

Negative Reviews: The view from the room, and definitely gets too hot without the air con but then too loud with it on.
Positive Reviews: Very clean, helpful staff, you can get bikes for free, nice feel about it in general.

Review Title: Friendly staff, central location, but hotel needs a bit of updating and it was expensive.
Negative Reviews: Location felt a little unsafe. The carpets in the bedrooms needed updating.
Positive Reviews: Staff and size of room.

Negative Reviews: The area is very close to the city center but it is on the infamous 3rd street. Even if the homeless are mostly harmless, it is not a place you’re comfortable with. The hotel also lacks very basic stuff like a gym, breakfast and a proper business room. I would not consider this as an option for a business trip. Also, if you get the wrong neighbor, you’ll hear everything he does, at any time.
Positive Reviews: Staff is helpful, rooms are clean.

Negative Reviews: Everything felt a bit tired in the room. They are in the middle of redecorating the communal patio area though. When we called ahead for parking it would have also been helpful to know that the Pride Parade was on that day on the next street along (4th) which meant all traffic was diverted and we couldn't drive to the hotel. We worked it out, but that could have been extra helpful.
Positive Reviews: The staff were helpful in checking us in even though we were very early. We stowed the bags in their room and when we returned at the appointed time they had already taken the bags up to our room. They gave us the highest floor to satisfy a request for the quieter room but this room was not that quiet as it faced the alleyway and the sound of the glass recycling bin collections awoke us. There were a few quieter rooms bu these had already been allocated.

Review Title: Nice inside, friendly helpful staff! Needs a little more attention to room cleanliness.
Negative Reviews:
The street loading/parking spot was well, just that. One spot with no real accessible loading path. There was another vehicle there when we arrived so we had to park illegally to unload. Then on departure,  there was a garden between the parking spot and the front door with 2 small paths through that made it difficult to load.

Our room was not cleaned properly. The light switches were dirty and we found an old dried up dog poo behind the curtain, which made us question the cleanliness of the entire carpet...Oops!

Unfortunately, and the most uncomfortable factor of this Hotel And no fault of their own, there was a significant homeless population around this property. It made for unsanitary area's to walk our dogs and uneasy and unsafe feeling in my wife. It is the main reason behind my lower than usual scores for this Hotel.

Thank you to the Staff for their good customer service!
Positive Reviews: The Guest Service was Good. The Hotel was well maintained with up to date interior; carpet, furniture bathroom sink and mirrors etc. Overall I was pleased with the design and good interior design and quality construction of remodel.

Negative Reviews: The parking garage was in a weird location and the spots were extremely small, however it was locked to the public which I really appreciated. The area was a little rough but that’s just downtown Seattle.
Positive Reviews: Super close walk to downtown, friendly staff, clean rooms, locked parking garage.

Negative Reviews: The location was good for getting around the city easily, but the location right outside of the hotel was not the best. There was a lot of noise and people around at all hours of the day and night.
Positive Reviews: The hotel staff was nice and very helpful, good amenities, and getting free bike rentals was a nice touch. The room and hotel were clean. The outdoor rooftop was great.

Review Title: This is a great little hotel!

Positive Reviews: the room was cute and comfortable. loved the dark curtains. the staff was awesome. especially all the responses I received for all my email questions! very appreciated and Accommodating

There is a large number of homeless people hanging around.  Not a comfortable place to be walking around at night.  By the way, I am from Chicago so I’m used to being in the city. Otherwise, the location would be perfect as it has good access to both the Space Seattle and the museums and then the waterfront.  Having said that I do feel for the plight of the homeless people.

Review Title: Overall, enjoyed out stay at the Belltown Inn
Negative Reviews: Number of homeless people outside of hotel doors.  No breakfast available.
Positive Reviews: Close proximity to downtown, public transportation (from Airport) and Cruise ship port.  Hotel was clean and had a roof top terrace.

Negative Reviews:
Neighborhood awash with drug users and homeless people, sadly. 

Restaurants in the area had good food but very expensive.
Positive Reviews:
Clean comfortable room. Walking distance to Pike Place Market.

Shuttle drivers were great.

Negative Reviews:
No breakfast. 
Flavour of the coffee served at the reception was not good.
Positive Reviews: size o the room. Lighting was good. fridge and microwave super convenient.

Negative Reviews: I did not like the situation outside of the hotel. There are a lot of homeless people always outside drinking and it reeks of urine as soon as you walk out. If I wasn't accompanied by my partner, I would not have felt comfortable walking outside by myself.
Positive Reviews: I liked how seamless the entire process of staying there was. Checking in and getting to our room was easy and the rest of the stay everything went well. I especially liked that the property had free bike rentals for guests. The room was exactly what we needed for a 2 person trip in Seattle. The Belltown Inn claims that you can walk everywhere and you really can. We pretty much walked everywhere we needed to go, including all of the touristy attractions.

Negative Reviews: The area has a high population of people who are using drugs and/or experiencing homelessness. I would not have felt comfortable exploring the area around the hotel after dark as a woman on my own, this is not fault of the hotel just good information for anyone unfamiliar with the city.
Positive Reviews: The room was very quiet and the curtains blocked most of the light. The room was very clean. The staff at the front desk were quite warm and helpful. We were able to use their parking stalls which made parking much simpler. We walked everywhere after we parked for the weekend, most things are close by.

Review Title: This was our honeymoon night after getting married earlier in the day. Was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly
Positive Reviews: It was clean for an older facility, and you have an excellent staff. Friendly and accommodating.

Positive Reviews: Walking distance to Pike, Belltown bars right around the corner. Super clean and the staff were always very pleasant.

I will definitely stay here on my next visit to this beautiful city!!
Staff were really nice, thoughtful amenities like umbrellas and bikes for rent. Room was clean and comfy. Wifi was good.

Otherwise, the petite queen room was exactly what I needed.  staff, all shifts, were professional, kind, considerate and helpful.

I know that street present people need a place to stay too, I was perhaps a little unprepared for the reality.
Positive Reviews: The hotel itself once inside was lovely.  It was in a convenient location to markets and Seattle city.  Staff were lovely and helpful.

Review Title: Great location for a comfy, basic short stay in the city!
Negative Reviews: Only minor quibbles: we were told there was a selection of snacks and beverages in the room but it ended up being two small bags of cheez-its and a pod of coffee. The heat lamp in the bathroom didn't work, just acted as a vent.

Comfortable clean good sized room. Outlook to dog park across road and to city from 5th floor. Double windows for noise.

Friendly helpful staff gave us early access to our room.

Review Title: We recommend and would absolutely stay again , even for longer than just 1 night.
Negative Reviews:
Honestly can’t recall anything we didn’t like. So it is in an area with a homeless population. Not a line of tents on the street, but people milling about. Not in excess either, that we saw. None of it bothered us. We even ventured into the small local grocery store next door which was an experience, but not scary or dangerous. 
The hotel itself is at a great rate for what you get and with an easy walk to Pike & Needle, each about a half mile away.
Positive Reviews:
Front desk personnel are wonderful people. Friendly, happy, helpful, efficient. Especially the lady whose name starts with an M - like Melva, but that’s not it - so helpful and friendly, dealing with our luggage for us before room was ready, reserving us a shuttle to pier 91 the next day. Above and beyond all around. Kudos to all of them, but especially to the hotel manager or owner who hired and trained these remarkable people.  
Beyond that, hotel is very clean and comfortable. The room is small, being an older building. Elevator worked fine. We were on 2nd floor overlooking the walkway with the huge chess board. It was very quiet. We enjoyed rooftop “lounge” where we brought up purchased drinks and snacks and enjoyed unwinding up there after a day of sightseeing.

Negative Reviews: There were quite a few groups of homeless people outside the hotel. We didn’t feel very comfortable exploring the area after dusk.
Positive Reviews: Staff were friendly. Room was clean. Working TV. Bicycles were available to rent for free. Close to bars/restaurants on 2nd Avenue.

The hotel was super clean and in perfect walking distance to all the major sites in Seattle. Plenty of restaurant/bar options nearby. Staff was extremely welcoming and hotel felt secure.

The morning and gave office staff the screw.  They didn’t even offer me a bandaid or discount.  Will definitely not stay there again.

Negative Reviews: Although I knew it, there was no possibility to eat or buy food at the hotel. Also there was no possibility to boil water for tea, not only coffee. Too, despite a microwave, no dishes or utensils were available. But small things, I enjoyed mostly the friendly and addommodating personnel.
Positive Reviews: The personnel were wonderful , friendly and helpful. Liked the roof. Location was really on the border. A little bit seedy. Bus connections good, location walking distance to market and space needle park.

Review Title: One can ruin it. Try not to let it.
Negative Reviews: Front desk employee in the morning, male with a beard, wore a mask around those who did and didn't when others around him didn't, literally flipped out and had to walk away from my fiancée and I when nobody fully explained how parking works for those who travel to the "most pet friendly city". We liked Seattle for this, but it truly was ruined for us by the hotel employee, and this is a first for me to write this, but I can't ignore it. Just as a decency, those who stay at hotels generally aren't accommodated to the area in which they are staying and it's always appreciated feeling like there's a safe place to be in a relatively unfamiliar area. Upon arrival from the east side of Washington, there's a parking lot we plan to use, but getting a pass for the lot isn't the most clear, so we go inside to see what they may offer or at least advice. A kind young woman said we could park on the street because Sundays are free and can move it by 8am the next morning and get a parking pass through republic parking for $30 and we can go in and out of whatever lot we choose. Excellent. Next morning, about 7am, I ask the front desk employee that I mentioned and he advised that there weren't any available. I was confused, nobody said that there was a limit, especially since we just took our dog out, checked our vehicle and to see if there were any spots left in the lot (there were). My fiancée just started to chime in and I said they didn't have any passes available, so she asked him what he meant by that. That when emotions flared up from him quite unexpectedly, as if we were prepared for him to literally tell her to "okay lady, you need to calm down, don't need to freak out" as he start to shake his hands in the air and walk away to the back. Mind you, we still don't know what it means that they don't have any left, we didn't know they could run out.
Positive Reviews: Room was nice and perfect size, comfortable bed too. Great walking distance to everything. Hotel staff, otherwise, are kind and welcoming to everyone including my pup.

Review Title: The hotel was fine.  However, the location itself has drug addicts outside openly doing drugs.
Negative Reviews:
The neighborhood is questionable at best.  There was a drug deal directly outside the main front door in the late afternoon.   My rule of thumb in areas that are questionable is to walk at a brisk pace and don't engage.  It's similar to being in Paris and someone is trying to get you to sign a petition and then they demand money.  You just don't engage.  Multiple homeless tried to engage anyway with a few rants with one being aggressive about fighting.  Something I normally wouldn't do is take a 1 mile Uber ride as it's generally pointless.  I did that after leaving the Space Needle after 9:30pm.  On two occasions I saw people injecting themselves with drugs.  I've been to every large city in the United States and have experienced quite a lot.  What I saw in Belltown was worse than anything observed down in L.A. on Hollywood Blvd.

Apologies to the property but I can't do it again unless Belltown cleans the open drug usage up a bit.
Positive Reviews: The location between the ship terminals, Seattle Center and Pike Place seemed good in theory.  All were equidistant from the hotel.

They offered a roll away bed for a fee. I booked this room 2 months in advance, talked to the facility, even added a night. The first night we stayed and called to see where the roll away was  , we were told it was against fire marshall's code to have the roll away in our room. They offered a comp room, which had no time frame on the availability, for the one who was going to use the roll awy.  After some conversation, we declined the extra room. They brought the roll away when we agreed to take the responsibility of the code breaking on ourselves. When the roll away was down, we had to climb over it to use the restroom, or anything on the other side of the rollaway
Why offer, and charge a fee for an obstacle that thr Fire Dept has deemed dangerous in an emergancy? Won't stay there again.

Review Title: Given the above, the thing that made my stay at this hotel stand out was interacting with Dean.
Negative Reviews:
I understand that there are many rooms for the house keeping people to take care of so this one is not a biggie.

We left the room in the morning to do some morning and early afternoon sight seeing and we came back to nap/rest before going to dinner. The house keeping people made it to our room when we were taking naps. This was around 4 pm every day. Again, I understand that they can't do EVERY room before noon.

The other thing was the lack of space out front to unload/load. When we arrived we had to drive around for about half an hour because there was a car loading/unloading and there were not any available parking on the streets. I had to call the desk and Dean helped direct us to the customer parking. It would have been fine with 2 - 3 parking spaces to unload in front of the hotel.
Positive Reviews: Dean is a rockstar! He gave my 11 yr old son a boost of confidence when he gave him directions. My son verbally expressed doubt that he was going to remember everything but Dean kept it clear and made him feel like he can remember what he told him. A simple interaction that made a big difference.

Negative Reviews: Wished I got the city view room like I reserved for.

Negative Reviews: The staff were rude, I was charged 275.00 the day before I left for a smoming fee when i never smoked I'm there. When I asked the supervisor at check out why he keep repeating that house keeping went in and seen... I had a do no disturb sing on my door the whole and house keeping NEVER came in and cleaned, make our bed or give us new towels or anything else so I don't understand how housekeeping would have seen anything in my room. I got the general managers information when i left, i called left a voice mail,  sent an email and then keep calling for two days. I am on day 3 and have not heard 1 world from here yet. I called the second day and the supervisor told me, "she not in yet but she was here yesterday so I'm not sure why she didn't call."  I would just watch your bank account while you stay there to make sure you don't get false charges.

Review Title: Avoid Booking Here If You Can
Negative Reviews:
DO NOT BOOK HERE! THE PRICE IS NOT WORTH SAFETY! On TripAdvisor and Booking.com this comes off with great reviews for a good price but it is not worth it in any way. 

We came into town around 2am and it was not the greatest surrounding area. The pictures don’t tell the whole picture in any way. The parking associated with the Inn is not safe at all. One parking lot across the street is filled with random people sitting on others cars and the other is down a dark alley underground. The staff at the front desk advised not to do the dark alley “because you never know if it’s too unsafe”.

We asked for a refund for the nights we planned to stay and the HOTEL DECLINED! Though we attempted to cancel before our check in time.

Everything was lovely except that block of street before is a little sketchy. People doing drugs or on drugs all hours of the day, screaming. Felt unsafe when I had to walk by to get to the hotel. Please AVOID this hotel. Lax cybersecurity led to me losing data and money to hackers, with no help from hotel in response. Choose one of the many other hotels in Seattle who actually care about their guests. 

I was the subject of their weak cybersecurity standards when their systems got hacked and I received a message from the same phone number the hotel had previously messaged me on regarding my reservation asking for my room cost upfront. I quickly realised after paying and receiving a further request for money that it was a scam and notified the hotel immediately. Two hours later the hotel emailed all other guests telling them to ignore the hoax SMS and any emails from them.

As I had lost the cost of my stay at the hotel, I emailed senior management asking for my stay to be waived or some equivalent compensation. Despite emailing twice, I never received a reply and what made it worse is that they told the hotel’s reception staff to ignore all my complaints regarding the hack and my pleas for compensation, demonstrating they had read my emails and decided to ignore them. Genuinely one of the worse episodes of customer service I have received. Regardless of my requests for compensation, the least they could have done is acknowledge my emails with a response but they didn’t even bother to do that. 

So please don’t stay at this hotel. Given their weak cybersecurity standards, there’s a high chance your personal details will get hacked and senior management at the hotel will not care if you lose out in this situation. There are plenty of other options in Seattle - please choose one of them.
